Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: DougCapeTown
Reviews.Content: The Villas are a brilliant concept and the way to go when visiting Dysneyland, especially out of the golf season when the prices are lower. I took my wife and 25 year old daughter and we were comfortably accommodated in a large suite with a fold down couch in the sitting room for my daughter. The gate run an efficient shuttle service where you can be transported from your villa to the gate and on to your tour for the day. I took my clubs with me and played 9 holes early each morning, the course is brilliant and I was around 9 holes in an 11/2 hours on a cart. The club house is lovely for a meal if you choose to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “The place to hide after theme park madness”
Reviews.Author: Iris17
Reviews.Content: Although this a golf resort, I would highly recommend this if you are looking for a hide out after coming back from the Orlando 'zoo'! We had a great time visiting the parks during the day and coming back to an oasis of calm in the evening. The villas are in the middle of a sea of green, overlooking the golf course. The villas are a bit tacky American style and not my taste, but having seen the hotels in Orlando, this is by far the best option.

Reviews.Title: “"Mantrip" Must!”
Reviews.Author: CKintheMJ
Reviews.Content: As a surprise present after a rough year, my wife put together a surprise "mantrip" to the Villas of Grand Cypress for me and four golfing buddies over the Labor Day holiday. From the moment I saw pictures of the property online, I couldn't wait to go. This property is part of the Hyatt chain, and we purchased our travel packages through Golfpac, who took care of all the details as an experienced tour company should. The Nicklaus-designed golf courses were immaculately manicured and challenging, but not impossible for high handicappers (I'd probably be a 30 if I had a home course, and the best player in our group is about a 10). Service is SUPERIOR -- at the course, the pro shop, the grill, and the room staff. Everyone goes out of their way to be friendly and make sure you're taken care-of... I thought this was a lost art, but The Villas of Grand Cypress have it down. If you're going for golf, you must must must play the "New Course," a links-style course with symbolic touches to resemble, ironically, the Old Course at St Andrews. Yes, there are pot bunkers, and yes, you will hit into them. I've rarely had more fun on a golf course, though. It's about time for the five of us to start begging our wives for a repeat visit. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Feb Golf Outing”
Reviews.Author: Fatboyslimjim
Reviews.Content: A buddy of mine suggested we find a spot somewhere warm to escape the NE winter. I had been to the Villas of Grand Cypress many years before with some college buddies, so I checked them out on the web, picked out a 2 day golf package, and sealed the deal. 45 holes and a golf lesson later, could not have been a better choice. Everything, from the complimentary cocktails at reception, to the spacious elegance of the well maintained villas and the very accomodating staff was top notch. 2 suggestions: make the packages a little easier to navigate, and less hassle to fulfill ( annoying that you always had to have your paper chits with you), and a offer a concierge shopping service at extra charge for those who want the kitchen stocked before arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with lots of fantastic amenities”
Reviews.Author: Qandps
Reviews.Content: We stay here as often as we can and love the resort. The villas are nicely decorated and very peaceful. Occasionally, there is noise from a noisy occupant above, but all of the free activities (driving range, pitch and putt, bicycle usage, kayaks, etc) more than compensate. And the pools are fantastic by any standard. We love to hang out at the resort pool during the day and then enjoy the awesome villa pool (and hot tub with waterfall) at night! Only negative was that we visited in February and the main pool wasn't heated. They have other pools that are heated but the big one with multiple waterfalls and a massive swim-through cave was not. Still a great time had by all. We will return (as often as we can).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing after Disneyworld - great golf”
Reviews.Author: broadbeachboy
Reviews.Content: After 5 hard days at Disneyworld my wife and I needed some golf and relaxation and this was the place. We had booked through iPrefer using the Amex Playmore Package which included golf each day for the 2 of us. Our room was spacious with a great view over part of the course and was a short walk to the pool and restaurant/golf complex. The meals in the main complex restaurant were always good and our dinner on the last night at the Nine18 restaurant was fantastic. The golf choices are refreshing with different challenging courses and the pro shop staff were always able to come up with an alternative variation on the course mix although the New course ate us both up with its links/bunker layout.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney Time”
Reviews.Author: Ligirlnc
Reviews.Content: In Dec 2011, our family stayed at this beautiful resort! I hope one day our whole extended family can come and enjoy this calming place. My daughter and I enjoyed the pool on the days were weren't at Disney. While my husband was out on the golf course. It was a wonderful respite from our busy life! I would definitely stay again and recommend to others. Great property, great rooms, and staff -Garreth in particular!

Reviews.Title: “Calm oasis”
Reviews.Author: suejanethomas
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 2 teenagers who's primary objective was to visit the theme parks; so the villas really did provide an oasis from the hustle of our busy days during our 5 days in early July 2011. The pool was an absolute winner on arrival back 'home' after experiencing the crowds and the heat of the day. In fact the contrast so big that we may have been in a different city, one of beautiful green manicured surrounds and lake vista; no crowds, no noise - absolute relaxation. Moving around the property was made easy by mini bus collection at the door with an easy transfer to the sister property to connect to theme park and city transportation which was readily available. Our villa provided a large comfortable - could be send to be quite luxurious space - especially after having just travelled from a compact downtown New York property. Only negative would be the lack of a fridge in our room. A very enjoyable stay and definitely recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Weekend”
Reviews.Author: fiji222
Reviews.Content: Beautfiul views, clean rooms, friendly staff. Didn't actually get to play the course, but heard it was amazing. Free shuttle back and forth from the Grand Cypress. Dog Friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Family Fantastic - and close to Disney so you can enjoy it all !”
Reviews.Author: Kitty A
Reviews.Content: We recently took on Disney with 33 family members and found the Villas of Grand Cypress to be the perfect location for our annual family gathering. From the start, upon booking our rooms through our visit and up to our departure, the staff was extremely helpful. We had special needs due to medical issues and the reservations department went beyond the scope of their property to find us the things we needed to help us get the additional items required. Upon arrival - from the gate to the desk - everyone was very friendly. We pulled into the property after a 20 hour car ride and the bell staff encouraged us all to get out of our cars and enter the lobby for a complimentary beverage and snack of our choice. The bellman - John - assisted us with an escorted ride to our Villas and gave us the grand tour of our accommodations and the available amenities on property - Very nice! We also had 10 boxes delivered prior to our arrival and all were found and delivered to the room without any problems. Pre-ordered a crib and is was in the room upon arrival as requested. We rented (2) Villas - that had 4 bedrooms each with two double beds - (2) rooms a bit smaller but ample room for 4 people and (2) a bit larger with an additional seating area - great for families. One larger and one smaller located upstairs and one larger and one smaller located downstairs. Each family had their own room with their own bathroom and an exit to an outdoor balcony or patio area that overlooked the various ponds on property. Bathrooms were large and spacious with separate shower and separate bath. Only 1 of the 4 bedrooms (upstairs) did not have an additional outdoor access which was great for the family with small children so they did not have to worry about the additional door. We had a kitchen complete with china, glass, silver - full size refrigerator, dishwasher and washer and dryer in each Villa - great when you have a large group and want to pack light. Living room was sunken with working wood fireplace - long dining room table that would seat 8 to 10. We did build a fire on two nights. Patio area had table, chairs and chaise lounges for everyone to enjoy as well. Kids and adults did take advantage of the free bike rentals (full range of sizes for adults or little kids), the fantastic pool with spa pool and great Fruit Colada drinks. Several did get fishing poles from the front desk and tried their luck at fishing in the ponds outside our Villas. Great bike trails and running trails all around the property. The night guard at the entrance was a god send - giving us special directions to and from the airport that got us there and back several times in 30 minutes or less - avoiding I-4 - and the heavy, heavy holiday traffic that would have created and hour or more drive - thank you very much for that. Did not golf but the courses looked amazing - Did eat breakfast in the Grill at the club house - very nice setting. Comfortable with good food and great service. A quick call to the bell staff provide transportation for the elderly members of the family over to the club house for their meal. Needed assistance with boarding passes from the concierge and they had them all printed and bound in nice package for easy access. Thank you concierge. The night front desk clerk on New Year's eve, and on New Year's day was very nice and helped us several times with additional keys for the various rooms and she always had a smile. Housekeeping staff friendly and efficient. Helped us with a few requests again due to medical needs with no hesitation. Needed to rent a DVD player and the bell staff was at our door with the machine within minutes of the call. Great and quick service - as Villa's were fully booked for the holiday. We hit the all 4 parks at Disney and Universal and found easy access to and from the parks via car however there is a shuttle service from the Grand Cypress Hyatt - so you could take a shuttle from the Villas to the Hyatt just across the street and to the parks from there if you did not have your own transportation. Parking for all our cars was directly outside our Villa. We did have access to all the services at the Hyatt as well that included the tennis courts and the basketball courts which the teenage boys used during our visit. We really enjoyed Disney but found the Villas great because it gave us the opportunity to get out of the craziness of Disney and relax in the great surroundings of the Villas. The property exceeded all our expectations and was a great place for a family with diverse needs from 1 year old to 84. The Villas of Grand Cypress will be our destination next time we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “great golf”
Reviews.Author: Kmck3915
Reviews.Content: The suite we stayed in was 3032 and it had a terrible unidentifiable smell....the entire suite needed updating badly. The noise from upstairs was LOUD day and night. The staff on the other hand were great. the GOLF WAS AWESOME!!! pool was great. i would give this one another chance,maybe we just had a bad suite?

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are a bit dated, but the price is worth it.”
Reviews.Author: blewis1041
Reviews.Content: My wife and 4 children stayed here on Christmas Eve. Unfortunately, they could not discount our room sufficiently for Christmas, or we would have stayed 2 nights (instead of going to Reunion Resort and Club Wyndham - a waste of money). In any case, we rented a 4 BR suite, and it was great. Clean, great location to Disney, and extremely pleasant staff. We ate in the clubhouse, and our server and the bartender (we sat at the bar) really understood service. I apologized for being the only ones there on Christmas Eve, and the response was "We're here as long as we need to be to make sure everyone is served and happy. Enjoy yourselves, and take your time." They even overheard Christmas was my wife's birthday, and brought her a free dessert. This is a hotel that understands service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: jencck
Reviews.Content: Amenities listed: 4* HOTEL 2 nights December 20, 21, 2011 Amenities: Resort Fitness Center Pool(s) Restaurant(s) High-Speed Internet Access I must confess I have used Hotwire over and over and stayed at Hyatt hotels many times. After this flop, I will not use Hotwire nor will I ever stay at a Hyatt again. I get that Hotwire is "all sales final" but if you book a 4* hotel, they shouldn't be able to stick you in a "villa" 2 miles away on a golf course which hadn't been renovated in a good 20 years... Hyatt wouldn't budge, wouldn't move us to the main hotel and Hotwire says they can't guarantee whether you end up in a hotel vs a "villa". We left, booked the Hilton directly and had a great two night stay! (lost my $200, but had a much better resort experience.) Totally felt scammed by Hotwire and Hyatt on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frlm
Reviews.Content: The last three times we have gone to Orlando we have stayed at the Walfdorf Astoria and loved it. We thought we would try something different this time as it was recommended to us over the phone by an AMEX fine hotels associate. The property is gorgeous and a golfers heaven but the villas need serious updating. The kitchen area looks like a kitchen in a 2 star hotel. The carpet was dirty and stained and we did not feel comfortable walking around without our shoes on and the large roach climbing up the wall upstairs did not make us feel good either. The downstairs bathroom was leaking water onto the tile. The brass accents suggest a mid 80's build. It just felt old. We thought that it would be a great place to stay because it is part of fine hotels but we were extremely disappointed to say the least. If this had been our first time booking through fine hotels we probably would not book again as it was under par. The service at the restaurant was horrible, as the servers would stand around watching television while our glasses were empty on 2 different days. We had two strollers and there were steps in two sections of the restaurant and no one ever offered to help us get the strollers up and down the steps in our 3 days dining there. When we arrived back at the villa from Magic Kingdom at 12:30 am after Mickey's Christmas Party there were no parking spaces available at our villa. So we had 2 babies and everything goes with them to unload after being gone all day and no where to park. The front desk responded by saying to park anywhere around the property. Someone from the front desk did come over the parking lot but only to say I'm sorry and instructed us park on the curb. Nice way to get your car hit...now we understand why the parking is free. We told them at check in that we would like the 4:00 checkout (guaranteed to us by our fine hotels booking) but on the day we were checking out, housekeeping showed up at 9:00 to see what time we were leaving. The fact that they did come nearly that early any other day and that it was not communicated by their staff that we had a late checkout shows poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit”
Reviews.Author: cemSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Visited the Villas again for a coup;e of nights prior to our journey home. Lovely location on the edged of Disney with lots to do.Friendly ducks and squirrels visited daily. Breakfast in the club house was as good a ever. Will hopefully visit again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you do not want to be in the heart of Disney World”
Reviews.Author: QuitYourJobandTravel
Reviews.Content: The Villas at Grand Cypress is located just outside the mayhem of Disney World. It was just a 10 minute drive to most attractions and secluded enough that we could get away. The rooms were a bit dated but comfortable. The bathroom was very roomy. I would have liked to have a mini frig in the room, but you had to pay extra per day for that. The New Course was interesting play with shared greens. It felt a bit dangerous at times but I did enjoy the course overall. The staff throughout were very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Big group golf trip short list”
Reviews.Author: VermontGolfer
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have gone to Grand Cypress. Group of 16-20 golfers from across the country, avg handicap is 10 but the range is +2 to -26. Pros: Easy to get to, plenty of golf on property, villas are great, services are also great. Cons: Mgmt is prone to bumping your group around, and things do pop up... All things considered, this is a good spot for a big group. The villas are really quite nice. Probably one of the best we have stayed at. Close proximity to the club house is a bonus. However, I will say the resort does a decent job of making good on its promise of delivering a good golf experience. Here's why: We were supposed to play a lot of this facility. The New course, South, East and North over three days and 36 holes a day. However, we got bumped because they had a bigger group. To make up for it, they gave us free golf for that day. OK - that works with me. HOWEVER - when you end up playing the South back to back and the LPGA is coming to town and every pin is illegally put 2 feet from the edge of the green you kinda wish you were paying the money... With regards to big groups - some years they want you and other years they don't. I called last year to book and they turned us away because we didn't want to commit to 20 golfers. This year, they were more than happy to take our group of 16. I can't explain it. With regards to "other things pop up:" Our first day we were to play the New course, but they wanted us to start on the back nine. Fine - we can do that. However, when we made the turn (2hrs after we tee'd off) - we were greeted by the starter "Jeez - you boys play fast" and a healthy 30 minute wait to tee off on the front. We made it known that we were not happy about the situation as we were supposed to be able to play 36 a day and that wouldn't happen if we had to abandon our first 18 to make our next tee time for the afternoon. Well, they got on the phone with someone and worked it out. A ranger came out on course and kept us in the loop. Again - they made what could have been a bad experience into a good one, and one that we didn't forget. At the end of the day - this is a good spot. You'll be happy you went. Don't forget to grab a complimentary drink when you check in! Oh - the villas - very spacious. Plenty of room for your buds. We asked for a grill and they brought one down. Very nice to be able to cook in for this group. They also have room service (its pretty quick too). The villas could use a better equipped kitchen, but it was serviceable. If you don't mind the trip - check out Horseshoe Bay in Texas. Another great facility.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered bride!”
Reviews.Author: orlandogirl7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had my wedding at the Villas and loved every part of the experience! Allison is very professional and helped us through every planning detail. The actual ceremony and reception was gorgeous, and the complimentary villa was gorgeous! I was able to check into the villa earlier and used the spacious bathroom and bedroom to get ready. The views over the golf course were stunning! I would highly recommend working with the people at the villas for any event, and only wish we could have stayed in our villa longer!

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Sdleo75
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here, they honor nothing. We got here at 1:30, requested early check in, no rooms were available, and no accommodation. Requested a specific room there was nothing they could do, and the best part of it was she said "we honor special requests first". I have emails and my confirmation showing my special requests from early July. Avoid Avoid avoid

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel like a celebrity”
Reviews.Author: JTravelsWell
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Villas one or two times a year and have never been disappointed. The staff is obviously well-trained in customer service and are always willing to attend to any request. The location is close to Disney but you feel MILES away due to the quiet and laid back nature of this golf resort. The resort is great for families and couples alike. We had the pleasure of dining at two of the restaurants on site and were pleased with both experiences. The rooms are well appointed and very clean. A great bonus is being able to use the resort amenities of the sister resort across the street. We never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a shuttle to pick us up to take us to the other resort. Overall, a great location near Disney but without the tourist crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great time & excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sdelasab
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent... From booking over the phone 3 months ago to our checkout. Thanks to all

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: SilveiraMateus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Villas for a week with my family. It was a great and pleasant experience. Well trainned, polite and available staff. Nice, roomy and well equipped suites with a very nice bathroom (with a bath), confortable bed and working space. Beautiful view of the golf courts. Newspaper available at your door everyday. Free wi-fi. Amazing fruit plate for breakfast at room service. They have tracking course connecting The Villas to The Hyatt. All of this and I'm not a golfer...

Reviews.Title: “Never again! Departed Early”
Reviews.Author: 5startraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why I don't have the same opinions as many of the other recent reviews. The property itself appears much like an older Florida golf course living community. The first room they placed us in had a lingering sour/wet odor throughout the unit. Once we walked into the bedroom it was an extreme urine-like odor. The head of house-keeping was sent over and said she didn't smell anything and made us feel as if we were being overly picky. I pulled up the sheets on the bed and found a large urine stain, but the smell was coming from all areas. We were told this was new carpet. The front desk moved us to another unit which was much cleaner feeling and smelling. We no longer felt that we were in a Motel, but more of a small chain hotel. This happiness lasted until an early morning bathroom trip when there were roaches crawling all over the bathroom counters and our belongings. There were 8 roaches crawling on the floor, bathtub and counter. There were 6 roaches in the shower and another trying to crawl out of the tiles surrounding the tub. I live in Florida and this is not normal. We were out of that hotel at sunrise and will never be back!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the Disney amenities, but quiet retreat”
Reviews.Author: Portia52
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Villas for a weekend get-a-way and to visit with friends who were members of DVC and staying on Disney property. I wouldn't trade places with our friends for the world. We were greeted warmly and offered a complimentary cocktail upon our arrival. Our room was worthy of its 5-star rating, the bed was divine and the pool and spas were quiet. We were very close to Downtown Disney and fabulous restaurants and a short drive to Universal. We loved the privacy and the sense of calm, yet we had easy access to the best of Orlando! If you are in Orlando to take the kids to Disney, I would suggest staying at the Downtown Disney hotels or on Disney property. However, if you are looking for a quiet retreat at the end of of a shopping or Disney day or a great golf weekend, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for 3 nights. Had an amazingly large room. I was in a one bedroom Villa with a beautiful view of a lake, large patio on the water, with an area where you can eat outside, as well as a living room, fully equipped\full sized kitchen, washer, dryer, full sized dining room, bathroom with a jacuzzi tub (which was great to use after a long day at the park- would have been even better if there were some bath salts provided, but great none the less), the bedroom was very large with a sitting area as well which also had a small patio right outside. I couldn't have expected a better room, thank you Villas of Grand Cypress! Also, the staff was very friendly and accommodating from checkin, checkout and helping with extending my reservation! The resort is very close to the attractions, we did not use much of the facilites nor the shuttle at the resort because we spent our days at Universal\Islands of Adventure (15 minute drive) and our evenings either relaxing in our room or at downtown disney which is 5 minutes drive from the resort. Overall we loved our stay and will definitely return next time we are in Orlando! Also, our housekeeper did a great job cleaning the room and organizing our stuff in the bathroom and replenishing our soaps, shampoos, etc. I can't wait to come back and enjoy the rest of the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a long weekend with a bunch of friends”
Reviews.Author: Bluedevil1982
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights and played 3 rounds of golf with 7 other couples. The golf courses were in great shape and were very playable. The villas were very comfortable and had all the amenities we needed. We plan on going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you are planning to go to Disney”
Reviews.Author: eckdish
Reviews.Content: I alerted the Hotel of out late arrival and the person at the front desk handed us a key to the Suite and a schedule for the Shuttle. We found out that their Shuttle only runs between the Villas of Grand Cypress and the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. From the Hyatt you have to take another shuttle to go to Disney. We ask when we would have to take the shuttle to make it in time for Epcot and he said, anytime, it runs all the time. We arrived so late and didnâ€™t study the schedule, relying on the information received. We ended up at the Hyatt 5 minutes after their last (10AM) shuttle had just left and we ended up having to take a cab. We complained to the Hotel and did get the $20 cab ride reimbursed. Coming back was the same problem, shuttle to the Hyatt, another shuttle to the Villas. The shuttle situation was terrible; definitely donâ€™t stay there unless you have a car. I would definitely not rate this as a 4-Star hotel. It is somewhat dated and definitely needs some TLC. You are so far removed from everything and they donâ€™t even put a bottle of water in the rooms, no refrigerator and the newspaper was delivered once in 3 days. This was quite frankly the worst experience I have had in a Hotel and I would not recommend it to anyone. Transportation was an ordeal during our entire stay. Stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, for the same price you will have a much better experience and the people there were very nice and informative. Unfortunately we had booked the Hotel through Expediaâ€™s special price deal, so it was pre-paid and we were stuck.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Peace, Just Outside the Mania of Disney”
Reviews.Author: starty
Reviews.Content: In July/August we had our 2nd stay at the Villas, hoping that it would be as good as the first time. It wasn't - it was better. We decided this time to just spend 2 weeks in Orlando rather than our last trip of 8/9 days in Orlando followed by a week relaxing by the coast. This proved to be a great choice as the Villas/the hotel have a lot to offer for adults and kids. We booked a 2 bed villa, specifying the same one as we had last time if possible. We were given a different one which proved to be much better as it was all on the ground floor with no-one above so nice and quiet. The villa was very clean and I was a little worried beforehand that the Villas may look tired but they weren't and the gardens and golf course remained perfectly manicured. Decor is american in style but generally light and airy and has plenty of space for clothes (and all the purchases). The kitchens are well stocked with utensils so cooking (we tended to have breakfast and some evening meals there) was fairly easy. The cleaning staff were excellent. The villas have their own pool with jacuzzi, bikes and a bar which served food. The pool was never busy but we tended to go to the hotel pool for its facilities (see below). We ate one breakfast at the Golf clubhouse which we really enjoyed but was a bit too big for us so we generally then ate in the villa. We mixed our trip up with parks and down-days where we'd relax and we tended to go to the hotel pool which is large and has a slide. The resort fee includes the use of boats, a climbing wall, a pitch and putt golf course, tennis courts, (not sure about the driving range), table tennis - plenty to do. This kept our boys busy and made for a relaxing time by the pool where the service of food/drinks was great. There is also a games room which the boys enjoyed, plus a gym which we didn't quite get round to using. There is a hotel shuttle bus which can be used to get around but we tended to drive. The hotel pool got very busy at the weekend and it was difficult to secure an umbrella but there is some shade from trees. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants at the hotel or by the Villas as we tended to eat a larger lunch when in the parks and sometimes out for dinner. The location of the Villas are excellent, being just outside Disney and near to the I4 (although it was just as easy to travel parallel to the I4 to get to, e.g. Universal). One of the outlet malls is very close, just the other side of the I4 so we also went there a few times, plus a trip to Florida Mall to get the kids next year Abercrombie and Hollister. There is a good selection of restaurants within a short drive of the Villas (a bit too far to walk). If we were to return to Orlando then we would definitely consider staying at the Villas again, especially if we were to return to the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Time of our life!”
Reviews.Author: J0diZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a weekend trip in August for our 20th Anniversary and we were treated with kindness and respect. The Villa felt like a home away from home with all the amenities. Room service and cleanliness were key when searching for our weekend getaway and this is exactly what we found. The food was excellent; the attitudes of ALL the employees were pleasant and accommodating. We could even see the fireworks from our Villa, the entire weekend was magical. I could go on and on about how wonderful this way, but let's just say...we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “This was my birthday present from my daughter and husband. We all had such a great time. The suite was beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: Coral S
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Villa's for the space for the family and the very nice pool. Then we went to the hotel with the big pool, what fun it was.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Villa's with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: LovestoTravel919
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Villa's, having previously stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress, which we love. When staying at the Villa's you get to use the amenities at the Hyatt. At the checkin center, you are greeted by a friendly clerk and they offer you a nice cold drink (soda, beer, wine, mixed drinks - whatever you want). The villas themselves are very beautiful and up to date. The bathroom is clean and luxurious. The beds are very comfortable. You step down to the living area which has a balcony overlooking the golf course. Ours was on a lake facing west so we got a gorgeous sunset. (And you can also see the Disney fireworks). We loved sitting on the balcony both in the evening and the morning. They are also very quiet. All the villas around us were full (we could tell because every parking space was used) but we never heard anyone. The villas have their own pool with ping pong tables and bikes but we prefer to go to the Hyatt with it's gorgeous pools, waterfalls, hot tubs, etc. This is all included in the resort fee as is internet, pitch and putt golf, rock climbing, tennis and water sports; kayaking, canoeing, paddle boats. The gardens are beautiful and there are nice walking trails. When staying at the Villa's you get the best of both worlds. The value was great as they offer really good specials many times throughout the year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: shadowcat7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-part trip in Florida with the family. The first part of the trip we stayed at the Villas of Grand Cypress and we couldn't be more pleased with the property. Unfortunately it was only a 2-night stay - we wish we could have stayed longer, but now we know where to go next time we head south! We arrived late, but still the valet/guest service agent (John) was eager to help us to our villa. He took the extra time to show us around the villa we had, pointing out the amenities as well as letting us know about their connection with the Hyatt and all they had to offer there (which we had no idea about initially). It was me, my wife and 2 kids - we were pretty much completely lazy while there. We slept in and hung around the pool mostly. We wanted to take some of the bikes that are available to the guests out for a ride, but couldn't talk ourselves into getting up from the pool. Though we don't play, the golf looked great, and next time I think we might give the chip & putt course a try. We didn't go to any of the attractions (Disney, Universal, Sea World, etc), but when we do take the kids down to see them we will definitely stay here. All in all it was an excellent stay and we will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great peaceful Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: vern_50
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from out 2 night stay. It was relaxing, peaceful and a great time. The pool was beautiful. Our room was well appointed and had everything that we needed. If you are looking for a nice quiet restful spot this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas for 8 nights during our Honeymoon and can not speak more highly about the place. The rooms were clean and staff great. This resort is 10/15 minutes away from Disney via small back roads hence avoiding traffic, but feels like you are a million miles away. It is extremely tranquil, but is connected to the massive Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, where there is endless entertainment. Expensive but amazing is the Nine18 restaurant 5 minutes walk from your Villa.

Reviews.Title: “Not great !”
Reviews.Author: Jb140563
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here on several occasions years ago we were excited to be going back but it is massively in need of some tlc, the location can't be faulted and the tranquility of the place is excellent a real break from the Disney chaos but the accommodation was very poor, we stayed in a two bedroomed apartment and were fairly shocked on check out that the charged room tax and a resort fee per room, i ended up paying about 500 dollars more than i expected for a 6 night stay ,,! the bedrooms were ok comfortable beds but the lounge was awful, it had two dirty chairs and a grubby sofa, the furniture was so sparse it looked as if half of it was missing, the dryer in the kitchen made so much noise we couldn't use it and half of the bulbs were missing from the lamps. We won't go back again, Orlando has so much more to offer elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the peacefulness”
Reviews.Author: 1_hot_loy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we departed the security entrance gate, an immediate sereneness was felt driving down the neatly manicured streets that wind through the golf course. Complimentary drinks were offered upon check-in. Our one-bedroom villa in Court 2 was tastefully decorated, light and airy, with a spectacular golf course view. The course looked in great shape, btw, even though we were not there to golf. Restaurant quit serving breakfast at 11am, which I thought was too early for a Sunday morning...but still gets two thumbs up and a return vote!!!

Reviews.Title: “Something different”
Reviews.Author: Sprtlvr
Reviews.Content: A nice departure from standard 'box' hotels. Very nice rooms, if somewhat dated, with condo-esque layout. We had King BR suite with sunken living area. No fridge. Gated community, very quiet, secluded feeling yet only 3 miles from Downtown Disney. Definitely would do again. Booked through hotwire -- great rate but Villas tacked on $22 "Resort fee" on top of Hotwire payment... Villas pool is not large, but also, was not crowded at all on Saturday we visited. Also have access to Grand Hyatt pool, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: MissMouse1928
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because we were able to get a discounted rate since my stepdaughter was getting married at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. We wanted to be close to the wedding venue but we needed more than just a regular hotel room. The villa was very spacious with a spectacular outdoor space and view of the lake and golf course. The fireplace was a very nice feature especially because we arrived during a rain storm. I was disappointed that the inside of the villa was very outdated. The kitchen and bath reflected 1980s style and were a bit shabby. The kitchen was small in comparison to the size of the villa. There was a musty odor and a couple of cleanliness issues when we arrived so we called the front desk and housekeeping was sent immediately to deal with it. I would not want to stay here if I was paying full price unless they update.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property”
Reviews.Author: RennyNain
Reviews.Content: I went to this resort for a writer's retreat (so it was business with a dab of pleasure) and I loved it. I stayed in a club suite. Had a roommate so we had double beds (or maybe it was two queens), anyway, the bed was soooooooooo comfortable. I loved the suite. It was very large. It's much larger than a standard hotel room or even most suites. It was one large room, but it was large. The bathroom is a small spa. The tub was amazing and I took two hot soaks just because I couldn't resist. The sitting area was very comfortable and we had a great view of the property from the balcony. There was a lovely fountain which made it very peaceful. We ordered room service once. It was prompt and the food was good. I dined in The Club a few times. Pricey but yummy. The shuttle service around the property was also very prompt. The staff was nice, pool was well kept and clean. I didn't use the spa. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather have a smaller hotel room and better service”
Reviews.Author: Casher6
Reviews.Content: As another reviewer said, they certainly don't care if your room is ready on time. I have 4 kids and they wouldn't even call housekeeping for me. Front desk staff rude. Pool dumpy. This is NOT a 4 star hotel by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire customers be aware”
Reviews.Author: whchuang
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms of this hotel 4 months before our arrival through Hotwire.com. I made a request (twice) that we need these two rooms to be right next to each other, as my parents have special needs and really need our extensive care. However, when we arrived, this request was NOT honored. I asked for other options as we really need to have two rooms right next to each other, but the front desk staffs were NOT very helpful and we ended up having two rooms across the street, one upstairs unit and one down stairs unit. Not very good first impression. The location of the Hotel was great (close to Disney World), but we would recommend people rent a car if you are planning to stay here and go to Disney World, as relying on the resort shuttle to go to Disney World might not be convenient. The property is really pretty and peaceful, however, the room does show its age, and some small accessories are starting to show some wear and tear. The Hyatt Grand Cypress just went through multi-millions upgrade with its room (e.g. adding iHome ipod speakers), but NOT for the Villas of Grand Cypress. I felt sad that I can't even find a alarm speaker to connect my iPod @ the villas. The staff did not offer us options for the resort fee ($17 per day per room as of July 2011), which I felt was not really fair as we spent most of the days at Disney World and did NOT use any of the resort facilities (not even their shuttle). That said, the staffs (especially the shuttle drivers) seem to be friendly and nice. One little complain, if you stay in a downstairs unit, you might hear some noises coming down from upstairs tenants, which was not really nice. The upstairs unit (my parents) did not have this issue. But the ceiling fan (air conditioning) in my parent's unit was broken, which kept them really cold for the nights. Also, due to the hot and humid weather, there are a lot of bugs (not in the room, but outside the room in the balcony area, etc.), which for city girls like my wife and daughter didn't really appreciate that. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure”
Reviews.Author: SLP18111
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping, room service and the gated security staff were great. Had to wait over an hour for the villa to be ready after check-in time and the front desk staff at check-out appeared uninterested in our stayand how it went.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: GAgymtrav
Reviews.Content: we stayed over the 4th holiday and it was so nice to be able to return here away from the hustle and bustle. We stayed in a one bedroom villa (with our dog) and loved it. Beautiful views of the course. Awesome room service, golf course was excellent. Everyone was so helpful and friendly during our entire stay. The restaurant is very,very expensive and formal...not quite our taste. You can see Disney fireworks from the clubhouse and we could even see them from our room as well. The pool is nice, but the kids loved the Hyatt pool better. You will need to drive or the resort offers a shuttle service. The Hyatt pool has slides, a cave to swim through and plenty of kids activities planned throughout the day. Mine participated in a watermelon eating contest, seed spitting contest and then tiedyed t-shirts. The Villas are on the back side of Disney. You can easily enter/exit Disney this way with virtually no traffic. The villa was spacious and very quiet. Every room has french doors that open to a patio area. The front dining opens onto a private patio as well. You will definitely have loads of privacy while here. Also offers free wi-fi which we used every day without any issues. My only complaint would be the kitchen. Everything is glass and there were very few pots and pans. Also, the bathroom was huge with a stand alone shower and garden tub, but only one sink. The counter ran along the entire wall so I'm not sure why there wasn't two sinks. Other than that, this place was great. If we ever travel back to Disney area, we would more than likely return here.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK----not the best.”
Reviews.Author: wiggygailTX
Reviews.Content: Our room was not ready till after 5 pm ( we arrived to check in around 3 pm) and traveling with a tired 10 month old and 3 year old we were tired of killing time until the room was ready on one of Orlando's hottest days this summer. Then it took no less than 5 requests to get a crib delivered to our villa. The villa itself was nice, comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy Spot - Nice Setting”
Reviews.Author: Noisefree
Reviews.Content: A convenient stop on the way north from Naples, the Villas was a welcome surprise. The room was spacious and airy. The king sized bed was on raised floor overlooking the sitting area and sliding glass doors leading to a beautiful golf course. Our breakfast in the lodge (one of several available venues) was good, but a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “We Found Our Florida Place!”
Reviews.Author: JKCamelotCT
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous property and luxurious, comfortable accommodations. We stayed in a suite for three-night stay. Our room looked out on to the golf course. While there were other guests staying in our area, we hardly saw or heard them. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. We took a golf lesson with Todd Meena at the Golf Academy and he was absolutely fantastic. We also played pitch and putt at the Hyatt but did not get a chance to take advantage of the other activities on the grounds - paddle boats, bike rentals, pool, etc. My only reccomendation for guests staying at this resort is to definitely rent your own car, as shuttles to theme parks only run from the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Aging charm in an Edenic setting”
Reviews.Author: Soj0urn3r
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here one brief night. It was a last minute booking based entirely on availability so we arrived with no particular expectations and left less than 24 hours later wishing we could have stayed longer. Even though you're relatively close to Disney and the area's other attractions, the expansive park-like setting of this golf resort really makes you feel a world apart. Very serene and restful, the Villas would be a great choice not just for golfers but for those seeking a chillaxin' stay away from the hubbub of the more touristy areas. I didn't get a chance to sample any of the property's many amenities, but my wife reported a very nice lunch at the Clubhouse. The Villas also has reciprocal access to the Hyatt Resort's ample and beautiful facilities, which is a definite bonus. The Villas' rooms are in definite need of a refresh - the carpet in our room had many stains and the furnishings were showing their age. What would be major shortcomings at another hotel were made minor here by the overall charm of the place, the romantic setting, the size and appointment of the rooms, the views, the large double french doors onto a spacious balcony. The customer service at the check-in building? I can honestly say I've never experienced better. And the icing was the price: an absolute bargain. I've paid much more for much, much less elsewhere. A tip: If you're planning on spending much time off the resort property, I'd recommend a car. You're far enough away from attractions, shopping and dining that cabs would quickly become expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, secluded and spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: milly491
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotels.com and had no trouble checking in. Rooms were spacious. We stayed in a suite. Bathroom had leaks in ceiling from heavy rain, spider webs and little bugs in tub were only negatives. Lots of positives: beautiful grounds, big pool and hot tub, golfing on site, good room service.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis away From the mayhem of the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: Black_cat_HK2
Reviews.Content: We came to Orlando for the children to see the theme parks and were dreading the experience. However the villas where so relaxing the stress from the crowds dissipated as soon as we turned into the drive. The rooms where beautiful and spacious and the staff excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: DCWP
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious, but somewhat dated. I was here for 2 nights in April for business and golf. Good thing that they send golf carts to get people around the property, as it's pretty spread out. I was near the pool in the back of the property, well away from the golf clubhouse and dining. Good service, adequate rooms led to a pretty good stay. The company setting up the meeting and golf made these accommodation arrangements, and I'm sure we'll be back again. Not sure it would be my first choice if left to my own devices, but if I was going to Orlando with a golf foursome, I'm sure I could do a lot worse!

Reviews.Title: “Green as far as the eye can see...”
Reviews.Author: raingirl4
Reviews.Content: The Grand Cypress was a wonderful place to stay. Our villa backed onto a waterway of the golf course. The staff was amazing! Courteous, friendly and very helpful. A shuttle bus will drive you to the restaurants, the club house or to the Hyatt Regency where all amenities are available to you. The swimming pool at the Hyatt is a a gorgeous grotto style with waterfalls and suspension bridge. Karen and Moe in the spa provided a relaxing afternoon with a stress relieving massage. Lunch in the golf course restaurant was appealing and tasty and the staff there also good. The villa itself was nice but not exceptional. The carpet was badly stained in several spots and the decor is going to need refreshing soon. However, the french doors which opened to our private balcony where it was green as far as the eye can see was spectacular. It was peaceful and quiet and very relaxing. I would recommend this property to golfers, or couples looking for a quiet and even romantic place to be. It is a little far from the theme parks, or Universal studios unless you have a vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Just About Any Other”
Reviews.Author: robinhall44Westerly
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Villas at Grand Cypress for 8 days at the end of May was a great wonderful experience especially being that I am a big Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress fan. Prior to booking I kept on looking for a comparison between the Villas and the Hyatt and never found one on Trip Advisor so here goes. For a couple weeks in May I had bookings at both hotels/villas at a similar rate with breakfast included and had a hard time making up my mind so I'll try to help out anyone in the same situation. Start with breakfast ok? The clubhouse/Villas breakfast is awesome but only one entree included plus beverages can be ordered. However the portions are huge and the service is top notch. But the Hyatt's breakast buffet is legendary. So if you get breakfast thrown in at either place you have to give the Hyatt the edge. So ok, I finally chose the Villas this year and it was a the perfect decision for us as we were looking for serenity at the time. Ok with that out of the way let me compare the two places. As anyone who has stayed at either place knows, if you stay at the Villas, you also have free access to all the Hyatt amenities. The Villas are beautiful, serene, attuned to nature, much more roomy, quaint, needing some updating, but still better than any others in Orlando. The service is impeccable. Wildlife is right outside your door and you are right on one of the most beautiful golfing venues in the world. Tthe food at the clubhouse is above great. The sevice is exceptional. So why consider the Hyatt if you have an equal deal at the Villas? Now remember the carrot for staying at the Villas is that you can use all the Hyatt's amenities and they are far and away the best in Orlando. But why not just stay at the Hyatt all things being equal? Well it all depends on the kind of vacqtion you want. Serene and laid back but elegant as well - at the Villas. Or energetic, electric, and at times frenetic - at the Hyatt. One of the Hyatt advantages is that you are actually right there every single day with the best customer sevice people anywhere. And it feels more like you are on vacation with all the hub bub. The hotel offers a ton of amenities including it's natural and man made beauty. The rooms are second to none but not as roomy as the villas and not as attuned to nature with their serenity. . But remember if you are basing your choice of the Villas on being able to use the Hyatt amenities, you wll be spending a good 2 hours a day going back and forth, packing and unpacking, even with the free shuttle from the Villas. So it all depends on the type of vacation you are looking for. That is the key. Ok some things to consider at both places. A refrigerator in your room in todays day and age is a must. The Hyatt rooms include it free. At the Villas it is not, but you can easily negotiate the 15 dollar charge down to free of charge and also get them to throw in the micro. Also, at weekend time, in order to access the Hyatt pool you have to get down to the pool by 7AM because people get there and put their towels down on teh chairs, and then take off for a big chunk of the day. It doesn't seem fair but it's reality. And remember the pool area is the best in Orlando and is a huge attraction in itself. So if you stay at the Villas you are at a disadvantage for accessing the pool at weekend time. Also, the fitness center which is fantastic is right at the Hyatt's three lagoon pool. No fitness center at the Villas. The Villas have a very nice pool, but the water is very warm and no comparison to the Hyatt. They also have a snack and drink bar at the pool. Remember although I chose the Villas this time around my mind is not made up for next year. And also remember, every resevation rate is negotiable. You can make a reasonable offer and ask the resevation taker to take the offer to the manager. My wife and I look forward to once again being at the Villas-or the Hyatt next year at this time although right now we may choose once again to go with the Villas if the price is right. We absolutely loved everything at the Villas except for having to travel back and forth to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: juanp2
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, very quiet, has a gated entrance. Beautiful landscaping, rooms are nice, nice comfortable bed. Only 2 negatives. No microwave or fridge in room. We could here the people above us walking around. Overall, the good far outweighs these two negatives. Would definetely recommend to anyone wanting a nice place to stay that is fairly close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury haven”
Reviews.Author: nugs7068
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Orlando annually for the last fourteen years and have just discovered this tranquil haven. We visited with our three children ages ranging from 11 to 22, and they all loved it. There was something for everyone, from the beautiful peaceful grounds to the hive of activities at the hotel less than a mile away. the accommodation was very spacious and beautifully presented. The staff we met were both friendly and very helpful. We would like to thank Mr Yost who made my wife's birthday a very memorable one. The holiday was one of our best and we cannot wait to return. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of beauty and calm away from Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: steviedee60
Reviews.Content: The villas are situated on beautiful grounds and form part of the golf club. We didn't play golf but it was close to Disney parks if you want to go there (about 6 miles. ) We didn't go! We loved everything about the place and would come back. Good, quiet pool and a must if you are a golfer. The villas are very spacious and not on top of one another & have fully fitted kitchens. The facilities were excellent and we were also able to use the facilities about 1 mile down the road at the Hyatt Grand Cypress Resort. There is a shuttle if you don't have a car. However we suggest that you need a car to stay here. Our only criticism is that the shower water pressure could have been stronger. We loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hideaway in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: djlm
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes from Disney, yet a world away. This perfect destination is ideal for many reasons and family types. Whether you are golfing or visiting the parks, you will totally appreciate the refuge of this beautiful sanctuary at the end of the day. A great value, every effort is made to make your stay perfect...our was for the third time. It is great to have every amenity within walking distance. It's beautiful tree lined streets ensure a delightful walk every time. A truly wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: HolsRust
Reviews.Content: Slightly belated contribution, as we actually stayed in one of the villas in March 2010. Provided you're not on a tight budget, this is a great place to stay. There was some noise from the room above and they are not of the most modern decor, but the upsides far outweighed these very minor points. All of the staff, cleaning, reception, restaurant and ground (golf), were extremely pleasant, helpful and courteous. The villas restaurant served very good food, and it proved a very relaxing location for our 2 weeks in Orlando. The staff were happy for my 11 year old daughter to go out on the driving range, and the location is beautiful. It was in stark contrast to the obligatory theme parks we had to endure on a child basis (not our thing). It is also well placed for both parks and the "real" Florida experience. The local wildlife (for those not acquainted with that of Florida) included lizards, egrets, Bald Eagles, cardinals, armadillos and grackles (of hitchock fame). Will definitely stay here again if we go back to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort”
Reviews.Author: tuckwuck
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 8th year staying at the villas. My husband and son are golfers and can't say enough wonderful things about the golf course and staff. The staff at the resort was very friendly and accommodating and always went out of their way to be friendly. I read the reviews of others about noisy villas. We have never had that problem. We are always in a one bedroom villa which has always been an end unit and have NEVER heard a single sound from anywhere except a random golfer yelling "fore". We even had a guest with us in our villa and they commented on how quiet and peaceful it was. My only complaint would be that on the last two days we used the villas pool because the pool was so crowded at the Hyatt that you needed to scope out your seat by 7:30 am. The pool didn't open until 8 and it was very annoying and I felt like it was the amazing race to get a chair. Anyway, the towels at the villa pool were like oversized dish towels. They used to be the same towels as the hyatt and now they were changed. This made it somewhat uncomfortable and they were very rough and too small. They need to have the same towels as the Hyatt pool towels so that they are more comfortable. That being said, everything else was perfect. Even though the golf course was really crowded, my husband and son had a wonderful time. We will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy due to poor construction and sketchy WiFi reception”
Reviews.Author: MimiandPT
Reviews.Content: This is a nice golf resort with great courses and the villas are nicely located near the clubhouse but they have very poor noise insulation between floors and rooms. We hear every footstep and lots of creaking of the floor above us and being in a room that is rented separately from the villa it is attched to by a poorly fitting door males for lots of noise from next door where there is a larger group. The ac/heat fan is also very loud - not sure ot would pass OSHA guidelines. Love the golf but won't stay here again. Try the Hyatt nearby if you want to be near the golf courses.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lizzypumpkin
Reviews.Content: Once again we were in Orlando for a convention and had the pleasure of staying at the Villas of Grand Cypress. Unfortunately we did not have the opportunity to play golf this time but this resort is in a great location for whatever you are looking to do in Orlando. Disney is practically next door and a short drive away the Premium Outlet stores. The Convention Center is also only a short drive away. We had a great meal at Hemmingway's on their property. There are several restaurants to choose from. The Clubhouse breakfast was excellent as was service throughout. We all enjoyed our stay and I would not even look for another place when we have to come back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, horrible quality and service”
Reviews.Author: socalreviewer10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights - first night, had old, compressed down pillows that were quite uncomfortable. Called in AM to desk and said they were old, compressed and uncomfortable, and wanted others that were hypoallergenic. Given a very gruff, 'sorry about that, we'll take care of it, and then hung up on! Food at club was OK at best, room service was cold when served, never restocked bathrooms, so on 4th morning, had to call and ask for more shampoo. Very expensive, great golf courses, but very poor food, and poor service. Will not be back. You shouldn't either.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything, without the clutter!”
Reviews.Author: redx3
Reviews.Content: This gorgeous resort offers spacious green park setting, bicycles, pools, and everything the kids love just a scootch away from downtown Disney without being in the middle of the mess. We are from Florida and happily do without the neon and chaos, and enjoy the calm, service based, stamped butter (*wink*) quality of this hotel, that is heads and shoulders above its peers. Wish the equestrian facility was still attached, but the food service, adjoining hotel, and rolling greens--make this one a sure bet for all of us!

Reviews.Title: “You will get to know your neighbors...”
Reviews.Author: pcourt
Reviews.Content: Location and property is great. Staff is great too. But we were in a downstairs villa and good hear every footstep of our upstairs neighbors. Not just a stomping noise but a creaking of the floorboards too. Called the front desk after the first night, and they attributed it to a particular noisy guest who was leaving that day. Our new neighbors were just as noisy the next day. Additionally on the next day, we could hear word for word conversations from our (new) next door neighbors through the companion door. I'm sure the front desk would have moved us, but we were checking out anyway. I received a "how was your stay" email from the hotel, and responded with the above comments. Two weeks later I have not heard back. If I was going again. I would ask for an upstairs room only.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable service”
Reviews.Author: MEGDAVE
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay, and we can't find enough good things to say. Although we had to wait a short time for our room to be ready, the time was worth it. While we did not golf, after a couple of days, I wish we had time planned to do that. The room was great and housekeeping provided great service. We ate at both the "Club" and "Nine18", both provided fabulous service and great food. Thanks to the concierge staff for arranging transportation needs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: mille125
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a four bedroom villa with my wife, my three children (5,5, and 6 years old), my mother-in-law and my 13 yr old cousin. It was one week before a big LPGA event on site but this did not take away from the service. The room was great and our stay was enjoyable overall. There seemed to be a lot of amenities that we unfortunately didnt have time to enjoy(fishing, biking, golf, etc). The GOOD: The resort arranged a Thanksgiving dinner for my family at the executive dining center (approximately 25 people). This was very well planned and the food was outstanding. Compliments to the Banquet's crew. The SO-SO: Interestingly enough, the concierge staff seemed to lack information when related to disney. I know that the resort caters to a golf crowd, which is fine, but when you are three miles from disney, I really think that you should know some basic information. The BAD: There wasnt really anything that I would call BAD I would like to stay again and hopefully I will be able to enjoy the amenities more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful landscaping - thoughtful friendly staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: designeruzi
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Villas for 2 weeks and enjoyed ourselves throughly. The staff and manager were extremely courteous and helpful. The shuttle service was immediate (arrived in 5 minutes every time we called) and the drivers provided us with answers to any and all questions. I would highly recommend the Villas for the beautiful landscaping and peace it provided at the end of the day spent at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back”
Reviews.Author: garueda
Reviews.Content: Went with my family here last september, fabulous, one place to come back again, great villas, great staying, fantastic location, no disney !!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Golf Villas with a condo feel”
Reviews.Author: Chash19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to do a weekend in Orlando for labor day, and mainly booked this hotel because we 1.) It's pet friendly and we wanted to bring our dog and 2.) because we LOVE the Hyatt Grand Cypress Resort. FYI - This resort is a couple miles away from the The Hyatt Grand Cypress. There is a complimentary shuttle that runs whenever you need it that will take you to/from the resort, but you stay in little condos right on the golf course in this quiet, friendly community. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room - a nice sitting area, a patio that opened up to the golf course, and an oversized bathroom with jacuzzi tub (which could use a little updating). We found the bed to be very comfortable and the resort to be very quiet and well worth the value - especially for those traveling with pets, as some pet-friendly resorts charge lots of extra money, and they are not as clean on the inside. We enjoyed the bike rentals, and watching the Disney fireworks from our back patio. Overall, it was a lovely weekend!

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eddie_Fla
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a relaxing Labor day weekend at the Villas!! Everything from the room, quick and efficient staff, the quiet pool/spa, and the romantic 18/9 restaurant made this an excellent weekend getaway!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect golf trip with the boys”
Reviews.Author: mahoneynh
Reviews.Content: Our group of 8 stayed for a long weekend (Thurs-Sunday) at the Villas. We stayed in a 4 BR/ 4BA villa and played 81 holes of golf. It was the best boys weekend ever recorded. We researched the Villas against Hilton Head, Vegas, Miami, and Myrtle, and everything came together. The golf was superior, the food was great, accommodations were spacious and clean, and the service was second to none. Thanks Grand Cypress.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but positive”
Reviews.Author: cchaney105
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here this year. This time for a full week. The staff is friendly and professional. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable, great views, quiet, and very peaceful. There are so many amenities that come with the room and resort nightly charge. I would have to say that there are so much more than any other hotel resort in the area. It is a 5-10 min drive to the theme parks, but really only 2 miles away (Disney has their own maze of roads to get to each theme park---6 or 7 total). Once again, we did not get to take advantage of all the amenities because we already had 7-day disney passes. Some of the amenities that are included in the nightly stay are Free parking, Free pet stay, Free golf and use of golf cart (need proper golf attire though), Free Fishing, Canoing, Free shuttle to the Disney theme parks (we never used this because of needing to drive back to the Villa to walk our dogs every 4-5 hrs), swimming pool, use of bikes with lots of bike trails, shampoo/conditioner (not the cheap kind) etc.....Anyway, their rates are reasonable and very competetive. We couldn't imagine staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place espcially if you want something besides a standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: mk9600
Reviews.Content: This place is a hidden jewel! I stay in a lot of hotels so staying in a villa with all the perks of a hotel and more was nice as this is a lot like a condo but set within a golf resort so you dont have the usuall business travelers and families with tons of kids. The villas are set among the golf course with views of the course as well as mature landscaping that is a nice change from the hot open arid landscaping in Orlando. There is an $18.00 per day resort fee but this is not joke of a resort fee, it is well worth the money. It provides free use of golf range and golf balls, great for those that want to partake of golf but are not paying to play the course. It also provides free bicycles to ride around their resort with bike trails that are shaded, running paths that provide something to look at, and it includes use of pools, newspaper, and sailboats, water cycles, canoes and kayaks. This is a lot in my opinion and for those with children it can provide hours of outdoor adventure for a nominal cost. I also want to add that this is a member of the Leading Preferred Hotels in the Country. While the level of service is very nice, it is tasteful and not stuffy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, lovely accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: matlin_9
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Orlando with my family, and we had a wonderful time thanks to our accomodations. We had a large one bedroom villa on the water. It was magnificent. It was large, modern, comfortable, updated with all the comforts of home! I didn't want to leave the room. Flat screen tv's in the living room and bedroom, we had the view of the fireworks at night at Disney. We fed the fish in the morning right outside our porch. We watched the golfers play ball. It was great. The pool was nice, and the area is nice and quiet after a day at a Disney park. The staff is friendly and there is security. What a beautiful hotel. The only thing is that if you want to do more activities, you have to drive to the Hyatt Cypress, their affiliate. I highly recommend this grand villa.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review overall”
Reviews.Author: swlogan
Reviews.Content: Ok, so after returning from a 3 day stay at The Villas of Grand Cyprus. I've been an active traveler since I was a child, and I've stayed in many places, and I'm typically not one to complain about a stay. Generally, I know what to expect ahead of time based on price, brand, past experiences, etc. I'll break down the stay in three categories; the good, the average, and the bad. THE GOOD: -The location is ideal as it's super close to Disney, and easy to get anywhere you want in Orlando. -The grounds themselves are quiet, and beautiful as the villas are situation in the golfcourse. -The pool is huge and "resort style", and one of the hot tubs even has a waterfall flow into it. It's also open until 11, which is great after a long, hot day at the parks. -The price, we ended up getting our Villa for 97$/night off of hotwire. It was my first time using that site and I was hesitant, but I couldn't beat the price for the location. THE AVERAGE: -The room itself. While the pictures on the website seem to make the rooms like nicer than they really are, I can say that it's mostly on the average end. I say this only because this is supposed to be a 4 1/2 star property, and so I'd expect a little more from the rooms. They were most likely "modern" when the Villas were built, though some updating (esp. in the bathroom) would be good to correspond with the rating. Also, the AC system is dated, and as such, takes a while to kick in. The wood that was at the bottom of the door to access the terrace was rotting, and while the bathroom was huge, the layout was quite weird. Fridges are available, but for 15$ a day. Finally, while the golfcourse setting is picturesque, you can't forget that since you're "in nature", you WILL see possums, big spiders, mosquitoes when you exit the pool, etc. THE BAD: -One word, the SERVICE. I do not say this lightly, and I'm aware that things can happen, miscommunications, etc... but this is the service errors that we encountered: -The MOST awkward check-in attendant I've ever had. He was nervous, unsure, and I have honestly never dealt with someone who seemed scared by me. -The website talks about a complimentary courtesy shuttle to all Disney and Orlando parks. What they DON'T mention is that you are shuttled from The Villas to the Hyatt down the street, to then be shuttled to the parks on what I would call a very limited schedule. For Universal, there was only ONE pick up time, so we just decided to drive (good decision). We called the front desk to ask to be shuttled to the Hyatt, they said that they may not be able to make it in time, so they would call back to find a solution. The desk clerk calls back and says we can't make it in time for the shuttle, but that the hotel would pay for a taxi to bring us there, which I accepted. A few minutes later we have another call saying that the manager said that they couldn't pay for a cab for us and that it was our own problem, to then have a ring at our door, it was a shuttle driver. Talk about not knowing what's happening! - I called room service shortly after 10:30 to order a pizza, only to be told that there was no chef on duty. If there are room service hours, someone should be around to be working. -When returning from the shuttle to the Hyatt, we had to get them to call the Villas who said that there was just 1 bell hop working right now, and that he would come get us when he had time. Eventually, it was a shuttle and not a bell boy that arrived (again, get your act together) -Since there was no chef, we ended up ordering our own pizza. We got a call later saying that the delivery guy was at the gate, and he wasn't being allowed in. So I had to drive to the gate to pick up my own "delivery". While I was gone, security had actually called the room and demanded to know why we didn't "clear" this delivery with them. (One BIG exception to the service was our valet Bernie. He was completely friendly, helpful, and dealt with two requests that we had promptly!) So overall, a mixed review for a place which wasn't horrible, simply not up to par with the star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again (In Need Of Repair)”
Reviews.Author: RayJ22
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent the 4th of July at the Grand Cypress last year (3-nights). I had previously stayed there many years ago with some friends and was totally impressed with both the service & suite that we had. But, my return trip to the Grand Cypress last year was a total opposite of what I experienced during my first stay. I must say that the up keep of the landscape is AWESOME, but we spent our first few hours there dealing with BUG infestation in the bathroom & trying to open a stuck door leading to the rusty balcony. After they realized that the maintenance staff couldn't get rid of the bugs & repair the broken door, we were moved to another room downstairs. As we were leaving out later that evening I noticed that they had given that same room to another couple!! So, needless to say I will be staying somewhere else the next time I decide to vacation in Orlando...

Reviews.Title: “Orlando without Mickey”
Reviews.Author: philthenerd
Reviews.Content: This was by far a great trip. We traveled to Orlando as a last minute idea and picked the Villas. We signed up for family golf lessons at the Golf Academy and had the time of our lives. Our kids (11 and 8) could not put down the clubs. The staff at the Academy is top notch and our instructer ( Todd Meena ) could not have been better. Full use of the golf facilities with rental clubs and carts which was included in the resort fee and 3 near perfect practice holes ( par 3, 4, and 5 ) to use at our leisure. Transportation to and from the Hyatt hotel across the street for the pool, pitch and putt, rock climbing, boats and bikes. All of the activities were included in the resort fee which was minimal for what they give. The rooms are large and very comfortable and a value compared to what you get at other places in Orlando. I only have 1 complaint and that would be the pool at the Villas. It is heated and was not very refreshing after playing golf in the hot summer sun. So make your way to the Hyatt to cool off.. We are already planning our next trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sisisisisisi
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. The Villas were plush and spacious so it was great to have so much room and not to be cooped up in a tiny hotel room for a change! We stayed in a 2 bed villa and there were 4 adults and 2 young children. The kitchen was small, but adequate for our needs while the dining room, living room and both bedrooms with their ensuites were very generously sized. Room service was available the same as any good hotel and the service and quality was very good. The on site gold course was well maintained and challenging and the clubhouse offered full dining facilities. The pool that we had access to was deserted, but it was heated and great to for the kids to play in. A week after we stayed here we stayed at the connected Hyatt Grand Cypress hotel and the difference was like chalk and cheese. We'd stay here at the Villas again for sure, although it was perhaps a little pricey it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced with tired rooms and atrocious service”
Reviews.Author: NaperNewf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while at the golf academy at beautiful Grand Cypress. Picked it because it's steps from the clubhouse. What a mistake! Expected to pay $250/night but was hit with a $72/night "resort fee" on top of the room rate. The shower had a backed-up drain, so my first shower was ankle deep in scummy water. Called maintenance, but when I returned after golf, it was still backed up. Called again, this time they fixed it. Shared a four-room unit with three other guys. All our keys stopped working TWICE during a two night stay. The second time it happened it delayed my departure so I didn't have time to check out. Called and asked for a copy of the bill. They promised they'd send it immediately. They didn't. Had to call again the next day. The golf course is worth the trip, but whatever you do, don't stay at the Villas!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here as a break from staying in hotels and to give us a chance to catch up on some laundry. The villas are well located, surrounded by golf courses and trees and could be anywhere, rather than in the middle of Orlando: we even saw a bald eagle as we were leaving the resort. The villa was large and had an extremely well equipped kitchen, as well as a lounge, dining room, bedroom and spacious bathroom, with whirlpool bath. The decor was a bit dull, but everything was clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “17th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: CoasterWarrior
Reviews.Content: The quietest accomodations in Orlando, and our villas was quite comfortable.
