My wife and I changed our reservation from the hotel to the villas for that very reason, and we were not disappointed. Quiet is not easy in Orlando, but it is almost guaranteed here. Even so, the rooms need a little work. Caulking in the shower looked a little rough for a 4 star property, the shower head would not stay in place and it is totally inconvenient and unfriendly to guests not to have a fridge without paying for it. I get a free fridge at the Hilton Garden Inn. Even so, we left our villas happy travelers and would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Tiredtrader
Reviews.Content: No better place to stay in Orlando. Set back on the Golf coarse, always quiet and private yet just around the corner from everything Class

Reviews.Title: “Great value close to Disney, but rooms need refresh”
Reviews.Author: ny traveler 02
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa at the Grand Cypress over the holidays and spent a few days at Disney and a few on the golf course. Overall, we'd stay at the Grand Cypress again as the rooms were spacious, the living/dining rooms were good places to spend time with the kids and the full kitchen and laundry in each villa were key. The clubhouse/golf courses were excellent, but there are no gyms or spas onsite (they have in-room services or you can go to the Hyatt) and the pool isn't great (much better at the hyatt but again, you need to take the shuttle). In my view, this resort is NOT up to the standards of most Amex Platinum hotels and service was a bit inconsistent. The good: 1. Location: A calm, quiet resort away from the hustle and bustle of Disney but very close to parks (10-15 min drive). 2. Spacious villas: Our 3 BR villa had a large living room with wet bar area, working brick fireplace, patio/"backyard" overlooking the lake, full size dining room w/8 chairs, 3 nice-sized bedrooms with bath, and a full kitchen w/dishwasher, microwave, range, etc. as well as a washer/dryer. 3. Good value: Compared to comparable hotels on Disney properties, this was a MUCH better value for the space and amenities. A full breakfast was also included in our rate through Amex FH&R. 4. Clubhouse: Breakfast food was pretty good, though service was slow and inconsistent at times. The bad: 1. Upgrade/renovation: The villas need it. The furniture, carpet, etc were clean and well maintained, but they look like they would have been "modern" 10-15 years ago. We were definitely not impressed by the brown tile bathrooms with brown tubs and gold hardware (again, clean), bad lighting in the bathrooms (florescent bulbs), decent but not great linens, etc. 2. Saw a cockroach scurry by in the kitchen. We were on the ground floor, but still ... 3. Our key cards kept getting scrambled/de-magnetized so we were left standing in front of our villa late in the evening while one of us drove to the registration building to get new keys. And yes, we kept them away from cell phones and credit cards. 4. The shuttles to Disney run pretty infrequently and on a schedule -- we ended up driving rental cars there. 5. The $18/day/room resort charge is annoying. I'm happy paying it for the services, but it should just be bundled into the room rate!!! The ok: 1. Generally, customer service was good (esp. the concierge and bellmen, front desk was ok and restaurant was inconsistent). 2. The shuttles arrived promptly (within 5-10 minutes) when called, but it's still a bit of a pain to drive 15-20 min to the Hyatt to have access to a fitness center, spa services, a good pool for the kids, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGirlnj
Reviews.Content: The Villas at Grand Cypress was a great pick for us. It's quiet, relaxing, clean and offers great service with any needs/requests you may have. The villas are partnered with the Hyatt too so you get access to all of their amenities as well. They offer shuttles to the theme parks but only certain times so check with the schedule. Our villa was overlooking the lake. You need to take the shuttle to go anywhere but it shows up within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Dated”
Reviews.Author: tlman0203
Reviews.Content: This property has seen better days and is extremely dated. I tried this property since it is part of the AMEX FH&R program as I have stayed at the others recently and wanted to give this one a try. The pics on their website do a good job of masking the outdated rooms. I did get the upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite but had repeated issues with cleanliness of the bathroom and also the place had a bad odor. Since it was just me and the wife not sure we needed the space but could see benefit on booking if you had a family as it was roomy assuming you don't have same issues that I had. Also, I saw on previous comments a mention of a shuttle; however the shuttle will only take you to the main hotel so if you want to get ride to WDW be prepared to spend $15ish each way for taxi's. We had a car but did not want to drive as we wanted to have a couple of adult drinks at Downtown Disney. Also, my wife had an opportunity to get a massage at main hotel, but the facility was lacking. They have since moved the spa rooms from the work out center to the Hair Salon and the room walls are paper thin and not in a spot that is not very relaxing. There were some positives though and perhaps I just got the wrong room and wrong people addressing my issues. The property is beautiful and if you into golf, the courses appear to be good (I don't play). The pool at the main resort is also great for kids. The location is close to everything Disney but away from the hustle / bustle of the area. Lastly, upon check out the person asked how my stay went and I said I had issues. Funny thing is that he proceeded to give me a card to fill out as I could tell he did not really want to get into my issues. I threw away the card as we all have choices and I will choose to go to another hotel on my next O-Town Trip.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, pampered respite.”
Reviews.Author: FLOrlandoGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one-bedroom villa for three weeknights. Staff went out of the way to accommodate. Had morning coffee on the patio, overlooking the beautifully manicured golf course. 24-hr room service was perfect for an intimate evening. Resort pool was quiet during the week; poolside lunch was delicious. The Club House was an inviting locale for social relaxation. Hyatt visit was enjoyable - large pool with slides (adults may slide as well!). A revitalizing hideaway if visiting theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is great value and quality, year after year after year.”
Reviews.Author: YrsTraveler
Reviews.Content: We're about to have our third corporate meeting at this resort, and it's become an event that everyone looks forward to, not because of corporate largesse but because of the just rock solid quality of the resort. And as the CEO that signs the check for the conference, it's always good value. I have never taken the time to write a review, but this resort and the management there deserve the kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel and service!”
Reviews.Author: hotelbuffFlorida
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Villas at Grand Cypress on October 2nd for one night. I sure wish we could of had more time there because it was such a beautiful resort. The staff could not have been nicer--from the bell man escorting us on a golf cart directly to our room--to the staff at the club house restaurant--making sure our every need was met. I can't stress enough, if you enjoy and expect good service, this is the place for you. Our room/villa was very large and spacious. My husband enjoyed the free internet access. Bathroom was large and luxurious and the room was extremely comfortable for the four of us. The view was of a serene lake. My 13 year old son enjoyed watching the fish and turtles swim. The resort offered us free bicycles to ride but unfortunately, we did not have enough time. The grounds are just beautiful and the atmosphere is quiet and tranquil. I look forward to going back to this resort when we have more time to spend there. They also will transport you --free of charge--to all the theme park locations!!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service and Value at the Very Best!”
Reviews.Author: Omoti
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at this hotel from the 10th to 16th of September. I selected this hotel after careful research on Trip Advisor. Believe me, we were far from disappointed. Overview: The hotel is located on a serene golf resort, same owners as Hyatt Grand Cypress, (most cab drivers confuse the two). The environment is quiet and gets you immediately in touch with nature with its lush golf courses, trees and ponds. The resorts provides transportation within the resort Pros: I cannot praise this hotel enough. The customer service is one of the very best that Iâ€™ve experienced anywhere. The staff were genuinely friendly, caring and very efficient. From the moment we reached the gate of the hotel, we received personalized service. The check in desk made it look like they were â€˜expecting' us. They were very professional. Guests could help themselves to complimentary coffee, tea, liquor and other stuff at the lobby. The porter to take us and our luggage to our room was already waiting for us. This was done as efficiently as he gave us a brief overview of the resort. Our room was a club suite, spacious and beautifully furnished. Our bathroom even had a Jacuzzi with top quality toiletries and other bathroom amenities. Room service was excellent. Tasty and quickly delivered. I strongly recommend the salads and also the salmon with vegetables. There is a shuttle service from the villas to Hyatt and then to all the major theme parks. This is very efficient and saves a lot of money on cabs. We were never stranded or had to wait. Our dear friend Mr Dale (the villaâ€™s shuttle driver) was always there to transport us from the Hyatt to the Villas. The front desk lady, Rachael, the concierge, Mary and Gareth were very helpful to us during our stay. The resort also has a pool (which we did not use). There are complementary bicycles available at the poolside. We spent an hour on our first Sunday morning cycling around the resort, this was so much fun! Cons: NONE In all we had a very pleasant stay at the Villas of Grand Cypress and I strongly recommend it for visitors to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A truley outstanding place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JAWSBE
Reviews.Content: We used this as our base for Orlando and area, absolutly no complaints, i would recomed and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Against the grain on rating this OK!”
Reviews.Author: DAC
Reviews.Content: I feel weird in writing this review because so many have rated this so high so please keep in mind the perspective from which I am writing. My view is that our family came to Disney and wanted a nice condo that will give us some room without expecting a high price (in comparison to what is available) nor a luxury room. Why I write this is because I feel this hotel is trying to a classy fancy hotel and charges for that but it is not truly up there. It may be nicer than many condos in the area with an attempted look of high class but it is missing details: Price: It was higher than other condos to start but we did not mind and wanted to try something differant. What irked us bad is the $18.00 per room room per day fee that did not show up on our reservation with Expedia nor is spelled out on their site until you book direct online or show up and pay for an expedia trip. This adds $36.00 per day for our two room villa which brings it up in comparison and does NOT make it worth while to us. They should be upfront on costs and perhaps learn from Mickey who although is expensive does not hide any costs or surprise you in any way. Rooms: They are nicely decorated but missing amenities if they wish to compare to luxury places. Little details but for example holes in the trim or missing pieces of trim, blinds that do not close, the toilet seat that is missing pieces, the shower head that is removable but does not have an adjustable head, the kitchen which is tiny. Again all small details but when I pay for a luxury place I have differant expectations. I hope this makes sense. Parking: Not enough and you are not gauranteed a spot. We came home to zero parking in our area and got told by the front desk that sorry we are very full so you will need to try the other lots. For this price each villa should be gauranteed at least one spot!! Again details. Service: I will end with saying the service from the staff was great. They smiled, greeted us and followed up wonderfully. They made us feel welcome and by the looks of the reviews make people happy. Alright I hope this helps some people. Again this is a nice hotel and it made us happy but I am writing this review from the standpoint of the price and how it holds itself. I personally will never stay here again because there are comparable hotels for less money in Disney. So keep that in mind when reading or sending me nasty emails......just trying to help!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Family”
Reviews.Author: missesthebeach
Reviews.Content: My husband I and our two children just returned from a week in Orlando. The two of us and our 12 year old son wanted to do Disney, but the 19 year old son only wanted a little Disney and did not really want to stay at a Disney property. The Villas are about as close as you can get to Disney without being at Disney (10 to 20 minute easy drive, depending on which Disney park, Magic Kingdon the closest!) Still, once you pass through the front gate there is nothing Disney about the Villas--it is a luxurious resort community situated on rolling golf course(s). Although we don't really play golf, the setting was magnificent! We had just returned from a week in a drop-dead gorgeous place in the Bahamas and we were still impressed. We had a two-bedroom villa, which was a one-bedroom villa with full kitchen, living room with wide screen TV, bathroom with jacuzzi tub and separate shower and bedroom with sitting area and wide screen TV, and then another one-bedroom villa attached with same bathroon and bedroom. All rooms were huge and had french doors/windows with fairway/greens views. The Villas' pool was a short walk away and was very nice with a nice bar/snack stand. We ate dinner at the clubhouse sports bar one night and it was great! There is a great Winn-Dixie very close to stock up on groceries--it was nice to have breakfast in the rooms. Also, every, and I do mean EVERY, chain restaurant you have ever heard of can be found in Lake Buena Vista within a mile or two of the Villas. As a guest of the Villas, you can charge things at the nearby Hyatt, which is a huge complex. We went to their pool one afternoon; it has a rope bridge, water slide, swim up bar. The kids actually preferred the quieter pool at the Villas. Also, the Hyatt has paddle boats you can take on the lake. You can check out a bike at the Villas (easy to ride cruiser) and ride to the Hyatt or just around the Villas. My older son liked to do this, while rest of us were at Disney. He also liked the putting green, which is complementary. We were going to spend a night in Cocoa Beach when we went to the Kennedy Space Center, but cancelled that once we got to the Villas and saw how great they were (we just drove to Kennedy and back in a day--easy drive). Housekeeping was great and daily--they did our dishes every day! It was great to have a washer and dryer in the room after having already been on the road for over a week. The staff was helpful but nonobtrusive. Really, I can't say enough good things about this place. Wish we had had more time to spend there. I understand they have an excellent equestrian center in addition to a golf academy; sadly, we just didn't have time--maybe next time! Oh, I forgot to mention they have free wi-fi and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: BeefyWalesUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 nights in the villas. 1. Beautiful quiet secluded setting. Check in so easy. 2. Gardens, walkways, pool areas all highly maintained and spotlessly clean. 3. Club Villa perfect for a couple. Spacious with balcony and outside table and chairs. View of Disney fireworks. 4. Food and service excellent in the club bar. 5. All personnel/staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. 6. Golf great. 7. Recommend ed for a relaxing , get away from it all break!

Reviews.Title: “Shhhhh...Keep quiet about the Villas!”
Reviews.Author: chooochoootrane
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Massive rooms. Great atmosphere. Lovely accomodation and surroundings. It beautiful and everything you need. The kitchen was great when we needed it. We were able to do laundry and just spread out and relax as the rooms are so overwhelmingly huge. The staff, although rarely seen are super friendly when you run into them. We had a delay of 2 nights and the hotel only charged us for one at the lower rate of a different type of room. They also allowed us to move from a 2 bedroom to a 1 bedroom and gave us a great deal. Loads of facilities as you can use the Marriott's amenities as well. Just made it even better! We went to play golf but in the end we ended up relaxing and enjoying the bikes and pool. Can't say enough about it. Gettting married next year and thinking of taking the entire Bridal party the week beforehand just to relax and have some fun bonding on the green. Don't umm and ahhh about it if this is a hotel on your list. Book with confidence and you will love every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Hesitant to tell anyone about this place.....”
Reviews.Author: fedfan22
Reviews.Content: ... but I cannot stand to see negative reviews. I do corporate training and coaching, and let me tell you, this place has the best customer service I've seen, short of the Boca Raton Resort - or the Sofitel in Manhattan.... and, then again, maybe better. We went for tennis. What we discovered were the free bicycles that you could check out on arrival until your departure. Every day we woke up early and cycled over the to the Hyatt on wonderful paths that led through the gorgeous golf courses and nature preserves - past the equestrian center and the lagoon. The tennis courts were GREAT! And the tennis instruction with Lynne was AMAZING! I cannot even begin to tell you what she did for my fiancee's backhand. Then we would cycle back and spend the afternoon by the wonderfully secluded swimming pool. We would later bike over to the golf club for dinner.... we usually sat at the bar - the bartenders were fabulous - delish Cosmos!!! There were tv's above each side of the circular bar and they were happy to put on whatever we wanted to watch (tennis channel). It was great having the Hyatt right there for fancier dinners and breakfasts. Which reminds me..... while we were there a junior beauty pageant was taking place and the place was really humming... nevertheless, the manager at breakfast remember our names when we came back the second day..... from sight... he remembered our names... with hundreds and hundreds passing through that place.... and we weren't even staying in the Hyatt, but in the Villas.... I was shocked at that level of personal service. We're heading back later this summer. Oh, we live in South Florida, so the trip is just a few hours drive and we have our car. This is definitely NOT for Disney goers!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: lakers57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas April 15-22, 2009. It was a great experience in every way. We traveled to Orlando, my husband, myself, our 10 year old son and father in law. We stayed in a three bedroom suite which gave all of us our own bathrooms. We were on the go non-stop between theme parks and other attractions and didn't want to miss anything. It was great to come back to a washer and dryer, never had to worry about clothes that needed to be washed, room service was excellent on the nights we came back too late to eat at a restaurant, excellent key lime pie. Our room was on the lake and golf course, beautiful views, we could see the fireworks at closing at Disney World from our patio every night. Housekeeping was excellent. We would not stay anywhere else on a return trip to Orlando. So relaxing after dealing with the theme parks all day. The grounds of the hotel with the golf courses and everything else are gorgeous. It is very close to Walt Disney World and the other resorts without being smack dab of the middle of all of it.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hideaway in a golfers paradise”
Reviews.Author: DGerty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of April. The level of service was fantastic from beginning to end. The facilities are extensive and included use of 2 swimming pools, bike rentals, boat hire & tennis- to name but a few activities besides the golf! The villas are situated around the golf courses which make for fantastic scenery & in addition we were able to see the Disney fireworks from our balcony at night. The golf facilities were second to none & included extensive practice areas including 3 practice holes, pitch & putt and several putting greens, chipping areas, bunker practice & 2 driving ranges. There is also a golf academy on site. We had a great time & would recommend this hotel even to non-golfers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent golf resort”
Reviews.Author: Lizzypumpkin
Reviews.Content: The service at this golf resort was courteous and excellent all around. We recently spent two days here being catered to by all the wonderful staff. Golf was great and luckily we had a relatively warm day. There is shuttle service to nearby restaurants, etc. if you do not want to drive. We ate one night at the restaurant at the clubhouse and all was very good. The villas are very comfortable. We had the standard king bed with a sitting room and large modern bathroom with shower and jaccuzi . Very good toiletries. The only thing missing in the room was a small fridge although there was ice available just outside your room. This is a great resort if you are going to the convention centre, as we were, which is not far away. Or a golf vacation. Or if visiting Disney. We certainly enjoyed the golf and will probably be back here at some time for a golf vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: wnvinso
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Villas at least five times over the past 8 years and have booked a ten day vacation there for summer 2009. I simply cannot say enough good things about the location, the accomodations, and the staff. My 12 year old daughter loves to ride horses. My 17 year old loves Disney and the "whole Orlando thing." My wife and I love peace and quite. Believe it or not - you can have all three at the Villas. You are only minutes away from Disney, you can use all the facilities at the Grand Hyatt, and many family style restaurants are just down the street. On top of all that, you can close out the day with a quite drink on your own quiet and secluded patio. My only regret is that I can't buy a Villa. When I vacation in the East, I stay at the Villas. When I vacation in Phoenix, I stay at the Camelback Inn. Both are out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're a golfer, boring if you're not..”
Reviews.Author: Ritchissimo
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you have a broken ankle, cancel your booking at the Villas. If you are an able-bodied golfer, you'll enjoy yourself (unless you're expecting something in addition to the golf..). I broke my ankle a couple of days before we left (Europe) for 3 weeks in Orlando. I'd considered cancelling the trip, afraid mobility issues would turn me into an albatross around my husband's and daughter's necks. Of course, Orlando is the home of the wheelchair and a week's stay at the Portofino Bay went without a hitch. Then we arrived for an 11 night stay at the Villas. Though I had advised them a week prior to our arrival that I had broken my ankle and would need a disabled-access room and a wheelchair (and called to remind them the day before our arrival, as I'm obsessive), when we arrived - no wheelchair. Finally a Shrek-sized wheelchair was delivered later in the day which weighed more than the rent car. The concierge had ordered a giant sized chair. Finally, a day later a smaller chair was delivered and Shrek's chair picked up. The smaller chair had broken brakes. We asked for that one to be replaced and got the answer "there were no wheelchairs free in Orlando" (they should check out the Disney parking lot after hours..). Finally, 3 days later another company delivered a wheelchair which the hotel receptionist noticed was broken (the brakes again) - and still they delivered it to our room! All this took up our first 3 days at the hotel where I was stranded with no means of getting around, waiting around for somebody to either pick up or deliver a wheelchair. And of course, the 3 days were punctuated by numerous phone calls to the concierge/front desk/wheelchair company. We finally rented one ourselves at Turner Drug - a 5 minute drive down the road from the Villas. I informed the concierge of where we found a wheelchair and I hope in the future the concierge will know where to find one if a guest so requires. When you have a broken ankle, you are stuck at the Villas. You have to drive everywhere, except for the golf courses and a swimming pool, neither of which I could use, there's nothing to do. The atmosphere is somewhere between comatose and moribond. Being a noble sort of person, I let my husband go off golfing while my daughter and I spent our days quarreling over what to watch on TV. When my husband had an early tee-time, I ordered room service for my daughter and myself for 8:30 so we would have something to do waiting for him to play his round. At 9:45 I called room service to enquire where our breakfast was, they said they had forgotten to pick up the orders the night before and what did I want them to do about it? No apology of course. Otherwise, the room should sleep 4 in 2 queen beds. The beds are comfortable beds, but they aren't double beds, they are so narrow and short (even the passionately amorous - and short - couldn't sleep 2 in one of those beds), I kept expecting Snow White to show up looking for Grumpy (me) and Sneezy (me, too, the air conditioning would kick in at 3 a.m. and you'd wake up to arctic conditions in the room). The hotel did quickly deliver a folding bed so our daughter (good-naturedly) accepted sleeping on that so my husband and I each got a "double" bed to ourselves and avoided divorce. My husband loved the golf courses and found them in immaculate condition so at least somebody was happy.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable stay. Definitely worth the price. I can't praise it enough.”
Reviews.Author: Appreci8life
Reviews.Content: From the moment I contacted this hotel I was thoroughly impressed. I noticed another website that was offering a better rate and when I emailed the Grand Villas to cofirm the other website was genuine I received an almost immediate reply which was also a very polite one. Some staff at expensive hotels when contacted about better prices they give you the feeling they would rather not deal with you. The staff at Grand Villas was very polite and very helpful from the start. They matched the rate and they also advised to make the most of the resort fee by describing what activities the resort fees cover. The lady that took the reservation also asked whether we prefer a lake view or a golf view room which I thought was very thoughtful. One thing that always dissapoints me in 5 star hotels is the room. All 5 star hotels have fairly average rooms unless you pay exorbitant amounts for a penthouse. However the Grand Villas exceeded my expectations. The villa I got which was the cheapest of them all had the following: a large living room with a pullout sofa and additional arm chairs as well as a huge plasma TV and a fire place and mini bar. There was also a completely separate dining room. The bedroom was in a sense a double room. The â€œtopâ€� room had a huge kingsize bed with another huge plasma TV in it. The other room which was in a sense part of the bedroom was actually a split level room located a few steps down from the bedroom and it had another pullout sofa as well as some armchairs. There was also a full separate kitchen which also had a closed which had a washing machine and a dryer. The bathroom had a huge shower and I mean a huge one which had glass doors (not your typical shower with plastic curtains) and there was also a deep jacuzzi bath. And I forgot to mention my favorite: there were bath robes in the closet in the bedroom. All the rooms had doors leading to the outside garden which was surrounding the villas we stayed in. There was also a table with chairs outside living room which had great views of the lake and was undercover under some part of the villa. The car was easy to park, just outside the villa which was only a few steps away from the door. So we arrive at the Grand Villas. There was a security booth at the entry and after giving our name the guard was raised and we drove to the check in villa which is a separate building. On the way there were these great views of this magnificent golf course which impressed even a non golfer such as myself. At the check in they asked me if I want a complementary drink and that is when I noticed a bar full of ice with various alcoholic drinks in it. I don't drink and was early in the morning anyway. They advised the room wasn't yet ready (we were there early in the morning) but they would take our bags and take them to our room and upon our return all we would have to do is pick up the key and go to the room. Anyway, to save time I decided to leave the bags in the car and hit another amusement park. When I returned to pick up the key they sent two porters in a golf cart to show us the way to our villa. We followed them and as I described above the villa was stunning. Anyway, these were the best porters I have ever seen. I just got the sleeping kid out of the car after opening the boot and by the time I took him inside I noticed all the bags were already inside the room along with some separate items. These porters/bell boys or whathever you call them were amazingly fast. Even now I can't believe how efficient they were. So we established the vilas had great rooms. In the evening we went to check out the pool. What was great about the pool was that it seemed heated and even at 11pm it was not cold at all for a swim. I think the pool was heated though I am not fully sure. What I liked about the pool was the fact it was only a few steps away from the villas. Some other hotels you have to walk a lot before you reach the pool. The pool itself was not something special and yet the fact the water seemed heated and it also had two separate jacuzzis made it all seem great. One of the jacuzzi had a waterfall falling straight into the jacuzzi which was spectacular. There was also a nice garden close to the waterfall so it looked good in the photos. There were plenty of fresh plushy towels near the pool and there was also a ping pong table under a pergola near the pool. There was only one casual restaurant on the premises at the club house which was serving decent food. Another nice touch was the free internet access from the computer located near the concierge desk at the clubhouse. Of all the luxury hotels I stayed, I must say this is the one that impressed me the most. To be fair the kitchen was a little average and perhaps not so modern looking and the bathroom has some signs of getting a little old but these are extremely small defects especially when comparing with the overall great experience. Please note there are no shuttles from this hotel to the parks. It didn't bother us because we had a rented car (a must whenever you're staying in Orlando). The only shuttle is from the next door Hyatt and you do have to be there at a certain time. We were going to stay at the Grand Hyatt and we went to see it because they allow you to use the pools at the Grand Hyatt but we were much, much happier to stay at the villas. The rooms were cleaned daily and the nightly turndown service was also a pleasant touch. There was also a free inroom safe. If you can stay at this place do it. I don't think you will be dissapointed. I know that for me and my family this will be an unforgettable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Ghost
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Villas for 3 days last week. Although neither of us are golfers, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The accommodations were comfortable, and the surroundings were peaceful and serene. One other thing--we booked our stay here for the equestrian facility, which apparently is closing at the end of November, 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Very good one night stay, not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: jameygamer
Reviews.Content: This is very lovely if you want to just hang out. The room was good, the staff was nice, the bathroom was cool, and the food is alright. However, I prefer staying at the Beach Club more because that's closer to where I want to be. This is great for a golf course, but it dosn't blow me away.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing golf courses and location”
Reviews.Author: Stacey_Holiday
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in the Grand Cypress Villas and over all I would have to say we where fairly impressed. Rooms - I have to say although very large and spacious they are a little dated and dark. The light was appalling and overall it looked like it all needed modernising. Although I have to admit the rooms where kept spotless and the maids where fantastic. It was also lovely to have the peace and quite. Club House - The service was great and the food impressive. I did begrudge the 18% service charge they stuck on your bill but that was only a minor gripe. You could also get a free shuttle to the Hyatt Hotel which had a lovely bar and restaurant. Golf Course - My husband was amazed at the quality of the courses and was especially happy with the New Course which is a copy of St Andrews. The buggys being part of the price as well gave you that extra little touch. Location - The hotel is a ten minute drive to disney and minutes away from a great selection of restaurants. It was also minutes away from the I4 where there was lots of shopping options available. I would highly recommend the new outlet stores thats just opened at the bottom of international drive called 'Prime Outlets'. A number of people have complained about the free shuttle to disney to be totally honest if your going to Orlando you are going to have to rent a car. Unless you are planning to stay at the Disney Resort and never leave which I wouldn't recommend as there is so much more to see and do than just the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet only 10 minutes from Disney.”
Reviews.Author: VintageMissy
Reviews.Content: We decided on the VGC after reading reviews on tripadvisor and getting a fantastic rate on hotels.com Accommodation - We had a Club Suite Villa which was spotlessly clean and the bed was fantastic (soft but good support). The only thing down side was that the soundproofing was not great and as there was a large family staying upstairs, we did hear a lot of moving around and footsteps. I guess this would not be a problem if you had the whole villa to yourself. However, as this was the only noise we ever heard (the villas are set back amongst the golf courses, so it is a very quiet location), we are not complaining! Golf - Challenging course, beautifully maintained. Cheaper rates if you tee off in the afternoon. Location - very close to Disney and only 15 minutes to Universal. General facilities - the pool at the villas is large and was not very busy during our stay. Sometimes we had it all to ourselves. The pool bar was great, and having a phone by the bar to enable you to call room service if the bar was closed was a great idea. It meant we could order breakfast by the pool. The pool at the Hyatt was fantastic too, a real adventure playground. Restaurants - we had some very good breakfasts at the clubhouse. We had dinner at Hemingways restaurant at the Hyatt and the seafood was amongst the best we have ever had. An excellent restaurant. Salon - Used the beauty salon and found it very professional, was very happy with a haircut and colour. We will be recommending this resort to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Special place but..”
Reviews.Author: andrea.italian
Reviews.Content: Back to the Villas also this time.. I use to stay in this fantastic place since long time ( more than 10 years ) simply because I love to play golf and they have some fantastic local courses as well a super professional Academy of Golf.. And I do enjoy much more the relax of the Villas instead of the Hyatt Hotel. It is very nice each morning simply walking from my villas to the Club House . The last time I was at the Villas was two years ago . I've booked this time a one bedroom villa and everything was perfect about the accomodation. Just as an additional small note the bathroom in my villa was a little bit to small .. The Golf courses were in a pretty good shape but the North Course was closed and we did experience few days some local problems with the Tropical Storm Fay. The biggest problems I found at the Villas were Customer Service and some people at the Club Restaurant. I don't remember how many times I have been at the Villas ( probably 20-25 different times ) but the last two times here were pretty bad concerning customer service. No welcome letter , not even a small note as a welcome back , nothing at all . Never received an upgrade at the Villas , so they are simply ( in my opinion ) not taking care about how important are small details in the today world. As a final note I personally found the service at the Club Restaurant not friendly at all . I do not pretend anything special ( also because we're not at the Ritz or at the Four Seasons ) but a better care about service and food. I will for sure return at the Villas hoping these problems will be quickly solved .

Reviews.Title: “All Time favorite”
Reviews.Author: daisy91
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villas 3 times and have never been disappointed. If you want to go up to the Hyatt Pool( their sister property) you call the front desk and they are there in less than 5 minutes in a shulltle van to take you. They will also drop you off at the guard shed at the bottom of the Hyatt if you ask them ,where you can walk to shops and restaurants. The Hyatt pool is amazing, it is open 24hrs and at night time the caves and waterfalls are lit up, it is beautiful. There is a free bus at the hyatt to all the parks. You can also arrange for airport transportation in the hyatt lobby for mears transportation this will save you a lot of money because one way to the villas is $54 plus tip, using the hyatt services it was $38.00. People that work at the vIllas seem so friendly and happy , we have never been treated poorly, the customer service is A+++. Each year we go back the same people are there which tells me it must be a good place to work. One last note the bathtubs at the Villas are awesome, deep with jets. I have stayed at other 4 and 5 star hotels and i can honestly tell you this place is the best of the best. If you have any questions feel free to email me corshan1@msn.com

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane, what hurricane”
Reviews.Author: ctcomanchepilot
Reviews.Content: Sked to arrive Sunday Aug 17 through Aug 21. Tropical Storm/Hurricane Fay due to arrive August 18. Florida governor declares state of emergency. Asks visitors to leave. Will this hotel waive its cancellation penalty? Nope. You lose first night. Is this a luxury hotel? Not from how they treat their guests who are trying NOT to come into a hurricane zone. Hotels need to accept reality. This one refused to refund a deposit despite a hurricane enroute and forecast to pass right over the hotel. These guys need a reality check on customer service. I WANTED to reschedule a different date, still give them the business, but when they gave me the hard core line, I'll take the hit, and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Moment close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: TennesseePaulster
Reviews.Content: We could not have stayed at a better location. Everything was perfect. The staff called us before we left to see if they could do anything to help us prepare for the trip. The pools were the highlight of the trip. We will not stay in another Disney hotel as long as we can stay at this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “It is only okay....... really not that fantastic....”
Reviews.Author: lee_bear
Reviews.Content: You don't get very much more space than you would with a usual hotel room, at least in a "Club Suite Villa". What you do get at the Villas is peace and quiet, perhaps a bit too much of it because you may feel very isolated staying there. The balcony was not overlooked by any other people which was nice but the view was of mostly scrubland that is being prepared for something with a golf course in the distance. I really wished we had stayed at the Hyatt that is nominally part of the same resort, although about 2 1/2 miles away from where the actual Villas are, which are down quiet resort roads with not much sign of life apart form the occasional golfer !!. You see a few other people around but it is not like the buzz of a hotel where you feel looked after. It is hard to put my finger on but you don't have that feeling of being an honored guest, of being welcome and special. Perhaps we made a mistake in the choice, the Hyatt seemed much nicer on every front that the Villas. I will say without a doubt Housekeeping should be improved. When we checked into the room the bathtub was full of dust, well I thought it was until I went to clean it and everything started running around, yep without any exaggeration there were probably about 10 bugs living there. We came back one day to find that the maid had left our Villa door open to the world. I tried to complain to housekeeping but it turned out the lady I spoke to did not have good English, after a minute of mentioning that we could have been robbed she asked "Do you want a sofa bed"!! On the final day the maid let herself at 9.00am in to shout "What time are you checking out" !!! We ate at the Hyatt Hotel in the "Sports bar", well not really a sports bar despite their advertising it as such, more like a reasonably upmarket restaurant with a tv in one corner, $100 for two mains and a couple of beers but we loved the food there so easily worth it. The food in the Villas Golf Club was only okay, quite basic but good enough if you are tired after a long day out. As I say perhaps this place was the wrong choice for us, I MUCH preferred staying at the Rosen Shingle Creek last September.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: gmwhite
Reviews.Content: Loved the villas. Had a 2 bed villa which is marketed as sleeps 8 but we only had 7 and it was very hectic! Ok if 4 adults 4 children but we had 6 people aged 16 up and one child of 4. Due to a late check in (6oclock was classed as late!) the villa that we had requested with 2 double beds in each bedroom wasn't available so instead we had 1 king bed in each. This meant that one of us had to have a camp bed brought over and 2 of us slept on the sofa bed in the living room which was ok except for the fact that we were constantly disturbed by people going to the kitchen or going to the bathroom. The kitchen in the villas is very smal and not very well equipped. Only very basic cutlery and utensils-no proper bowls, cooking tongs, kitchen scissors, knives etc. Our villa backed onto the golf course which was lovely to sit out on the patio. Unfortunatley there were only 2 chairs though so we couldnt eat al fresco or anything and annoyingly there was a tree above the table which constantly discarded sticky buds which meant that the table and chairs were always covered in it and it covered u if u sat out for long enough!!! On the plus side we were also near the pool which was lovely with 2 additional hot tubs of diferent temps, and we were within walking distance of the golf club. At the main hotel their are a number of restaurants and a very large pool and plenty of activities such as mini golf, and a lake with various water activities. The villas are also brilliantly near the disney resorts but far enough away to get away from it all!! It was a refreshing change from staying in hotels and we all enjoyed the extra space and the freedom that the resort offered. I would definately recommend the grand cypress resorts and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: ardenp
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful week at the Villas; this was a family vacation with our 8 and 10 year old children. Our primary reason for booking our vacation here, in addition to the excellent tripadvisor reviews, was so that my son and husband could play golf and yet as a family we would have plenty of options for other things to do. This property was perfect for that. As mentioned in other reviews, the Villas has a quiet, more residential feel. There are 5 buildings located directly on the golf courses and with a central pool area. We booked a clubhouse suite on the second floor. This is basically a large room (bigger than the typical hotel room) with a large bathroom and balcony. I requested a minifridge which they provided for no extra charge. Throughout our stay, the service was excellent - very friendly and accomodating in every way. On our second day, as my daughter and I were biking, the bellman who had met us on check in greeted us by name. Our housekeeper was friendly and chatted with us as well as asking for our preferences about the room setup. On our last day, we also requested a slightly later checkout time, which they granted. On the premises of the Villas they have bikes (and helmets for kids). The on site pool was quiet with a bar on site. Most of our family afternoons, though, were spent at the affiliated Hyatt which is a minute drive away (or the shuttle will come and bring you there any time, on request). We parked in the self parking lot which leads right to the pool area - the Hyatt pool area is much larger with 2 pools, one more heated than the other, waterslides, rock climbing wall which is open from noon-3pm, more bicycles, and a sandy "beach" and lake with paddleboats, kayaks, canoes, and one person Sunfish sailboats. There is also a 9 hole pitch and putt course right there (clubs available at the poolhouse). There is no additional charge for any of these activities (I was told that there is a daily $60 resort fee, but this fee was included in our package, so it is worth double checking with whomever you book with about it) . It was great to have such a range of things to choose from. Golf- the North course is currently being renovated, so my husband and son played many days on the New Course and South/East course. (they told me that the greens were challenging, the New Course is like Scotland links courses, but I'm not experienced enough to give more accurate golf details!) The week we were there, it seemed very quiet and there was no trouble with tweaking tee times, and they got to go out as a twosome the whole week. Though the courses are clearly professional level, the overall feeling was relaxed and welcoming, even to our kids. What we most enjoyed was their 3 exhibition holes (no charge) which my daughter and I could play - it was quiet at the end of the day and we had a great family golf experience on several afternoons without the pressure of having to play 18 holes. Overall, though, there were no other children, perhaps a handful of teens, so serious golfers don't need to worry! Equestrian Center - down the street from the Villas - my daughter took 2 private riding lessons there which were very good - not just a pony ride, but she learned real skills even though she was a beginner. Dining - at the Villas itself, just the clubhouse for breakfast/lunch, and the toney Nine18 restaurant which had great food (no kids menu, but they made whatever our kids wanted - then again, no other kids were there the night we ate!). Salon - we also had pedicures at the Hyatt Salon (not sure I would call this a full blown "spa" though) which were great and the people were very friendly. I loved the Lake Buena Vista location of this property - it was very convenient with lots of restaurants nearby, and close to International Drive. We did not go to Disney at all, but the entrance to the Disney area was basically down the street from the Grand Cypress Resort. I felt that all of the previous reviews of this property on tripadvisor are accurate - this property has a very quiet and secluded (anti- Disney madness) feeling. If you were not interested in golf at all, however, the primary reason to stay here would be to have a 1 or 2 bedroom villa. With younger children or the need for more amenities right on site, you might consider the Hyatt itself (I didn't see the rooms, but the grounds are really beautiful and the whole pool and recreation area was great) since that is where kids will have the most fun. In response to one review about the rooms being dark - our 2nd floor suite was a little on the dark side but we had a lot of natural light in the bathroom where there were skylights. Perhaps a first floor unit might feel darker. The room decor is a teeny tiny bit dated - not at a Four Seasons/granite counters/lush bedding level, but extremely clean and comfortable nonetheless (and I'm pretty picky). We never heard (or really even saw) many other people there, even on days where we were told the property was full. There was some ongoing noise which was most apparent in the bathroom; I think this was the air conditioning units outside. Didn't bother us at all, but could be annoying to someone sensitive to sound. All in all, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Cypress is certainly "GRAND"”
Reviews.Author: Missy50
Reviews.Content: The Villas of Grand Cypress was a beautiful experience and certainly "GRAND".. An absolute beautiful resort from the moment you drive in. The Villas and Suites are extremely spacious, clean and the staff is accommodating, eager to please, fulfilling anything you need or want. It truly is a golfers paradise, with two great restaurants overlooking the golf course, as do all the Villas. The meeting room was large with two sets of French doors that overlooked the lake. The reception was held outside on there patio, great wait staff and the food was very good, perfect weather, lots of sunshine. We will certainly consider another meeting at the Grand Cypress without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Villas of Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: UrbanTraveler101
Reviews.Content: Resort villas were very nice and golf and weather were great. Very close to Disneyland access but not much to do outside of resort if not going golfing or to Disney attractions. Orlando is pretty drab and resembles a suburb full of all the chain restaurants you would never want to go to anyway. The villas are also affiliated with the nearby Hyatt and the pool at the Hyatt was great and there is a free shuttle to take you to and from each location. Also got free drinks at check-in and check-out at the villas. Very friendly customer service at the villas and some free golf is included (driving range, pitch and put course and three exhibition holes).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hettyb
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and teenage son just after Christmas. From the reviews I was expecting a top class resort but the villas were built in the 1980s and have not been updated. The rooms are rather dark and dull and reminded me of a 1980s chain hotel in feel. The bathroom, although very spacious, was very tired indeed and needed completely modernising - worn fluffy floor mats are not what I expect to see! On entering the villa there was a funny smell in the hallway - maybe damp. The housekeeping service was excellent, exactly as it should be. The only other comment is that most of the resort facilities are situated at the Hyatt Hotel and you definately need to drive to get there. I personally felt the Hyatt was a nicer, brighter hotel and we would have much preferred to have stayed there. We moved on to the Hard Rock Hotel, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: hotdognewfoundland
Reviews.Content: just pulling in to the villas you knew you would be amazed...the service was great the minute you entered the lobby... we had a room looking at the water and the golf course it was so peaceful...the place was clean and if you needed anything at all it would be at your door within minutes... the shuttles to the Hyatt were at your door within minutes... we had a 15 and 14 year old and they loved the villas, they went horseback riding on Christmas morning ... were able to grab a bike and ride all over... the golf was great (my hsband says)...i dont think enough credit goes to the young kids who are there to give you your golf carts and get you your clubs ...they were very polite... the Hyatt was minutes away for swimming or resturants... the only thing to watch is when you venture out to the main road it is one big traffic nightmare..so plan on hanging in the peace and quite of the villas and hyatt... thumbs up...will be back again im sure...

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: CTmommyConnecticut
Reviews.Content: The Villas are a nice tranquil place in the sea of Disney madness! My husband and I went with our 2 young daughters. If you are looking for lots of kids activities, this is not the place, but we really loved the relaxing enviroment. The service was superb. When we arrived at the clubhouse, we were escorted to our Villa and then given an overview of the amenities in the room as well as to the resort. The room was a good size but the bathroom as tremendously big! We went to the pool 3 times during our stay and it was always quiet. We also went to the stables one afternoon. This was a nice activity - very clean, horses are well taken care of. All in all, I would highly recommend the Villas if you are looking for a quiet place to stay that is close to all Disney activities.

Reviews.Title: “Another relaxing stay at Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: pcs1
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days between Christmas and New Year's at Grand Cypress and had a great experience. This was our second stay and we were glad to be back. We arrived well before official check in time (arrived about noon) but our villa was ready and waiting. Service at check in was outstanding. The villa (a 2 bedroom) was very comfortable - even with our son sleeping on the pull out couch in the living room. Kitchen was well equipped. My only complaint about the decor is that the villas are quite dark -- lots of drapes and shades. It's probably nice and cool in the summer but feels dreary in the winter. Great golf for my husband and I enjoyed riding at the equestrian center everyday. We ate at the newly reomodeled restaurant at The Villa's and at Hemingways at the Hyatt. Both very good meals. The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. Lots of room. Very quiet but with prompt shuttle service to the Hyatt for those who want more activity. The only downside to the location is the terrible Orlando traffic whenever you leave since the resort is so close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Jacq225
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place. Have stayed at the Villas several times the past 5 years and we are ALL always, always happy. Traveling with 3 children, 11, 13 & 15 can be a hassle, but the villa we stayed in was a home away from home. We always stay in the same one on the small lake. This is away from the maddening crowd of Disney, and is a beautiful and peaceful refuge when there. We just cannot find a better place to stay with all the space and amenities and atmosphere. Some of these reviews here state bug/s. Nonsense. I have never seen one while on a stay in the Villas, but we must all realize this place is in FLORIDA. The "cockroach" the reviewer spoke of was a Palmetto bug, prolific in Florida, and does not indicate in the slightest a cleanliness problem. My God, on the contrary! I am a NEAT FREAK in the "OCD" way and I only will stay where I feel its as clean as home (where the floors squeak). I cannot say enough about this place. The staff is extremely helpful, the shuttle always available, the place always superbly clean and updated. Some people just can never be pleased. The (very) few negative comments made are obviously from impossible to please people....and there are always some of them around in this world! In any event, the Villas are a beautiful place to stay if one can afford them, and I HIGHLY recommend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, room had issues...”
Reviews.Author: runningman5k
Reviews.Content: Stayed October 12-14 in Villa 4072. Location was excellent and very much away from the craziness of Orlando, with the theme parks close by. The service was outstanding. What you would expect from a 4-diamond resort. Shuttle to the Hyatt hotel was always prompt and easy to get. Check-in was perfect, with a gentlemen taking us down to our villa and unloading our luggage. Best values for food are the grill at the clubhouse and the snack bar at the Hyatt hotel. Other restaurants are very pricey, however a short drive to SR 535 revealed numerous regular restaurants. The resort fee is well worth the price. Played tennis, used the health club and had the run of the golf facility (except the actual course) included in the fee. Also included use of a 9-hole pitch and putt course at the hotel. The room (other than the new bedding and LCD TV) was in a 2-3 diamond condition. Lamp was out, moldy smell by the doorway which lead me to finding mold coating the bathroom ceiling. Bugs are attracted to the light by the door and come in at night upon opening. In Florida, we use bug lights to keep them away. Back door did not close unless deadbolted, as the strike plate was defective. Jacuzzi tub controls were broken. A call to maintenance promised a fix the next day, but no one came. Hyatt credited us one nights room for our trouble. At a very reasonable $179 rate this was OK. However it is not worth the value at their regular prices. Be wary of the rooms and from what I've seen an inspection would be in order prior to occupying.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: rikang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas of Grand Cypress for three days at the end of July and it was wonderful. The landscaping was immaculate and the employees were extremely friendly. Our room was really nice and the bathroom was incredible. With the hustle and bustle of Orlando and the theme parks it was really nice to have a quiet refuge to return to at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we were led to expect”
Reviews.Author: kirameki
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere really good for our last two nights in Florida, so taking the advice of reviews on here I booked a suite (half a villa) at the Villas of Grand Cypress. How I wish I hadn't! We arrived at about 1pm and were taken straight to our villa, which was very near the pool. The room was large, but the facilities (with the exception of the TV) were rather dated. The keys we were issued didn't work, so had to go back to reception to be re-issued. By the time they were sorted it was about 2ish so we decided to head over to the clubhouse for some lunch. Unfortunately it was full of children, running all over the place and shouting - not condusive to a nice lunch - so we took the free transport over to the Hyatt. By the time we got there it was nearer to 3pm and there was nothing open except the sushi bar (not an option when your husband is allergic to all fish) the pool bar (pre-packed salads only) and the little shop, so we got some chips and crackers and took the transport back to the villa. We went back to the clubhouse for dinner, choosing to sit at the bar. I ordered the chicken wrap and a salad and F had the kobe burger. I will say, the bartender made me the best marguerita I'd had all week, and I'd sampled a fair few! F's burger looked really tasty, but my chicken wrap was not just cold but chilled almost to the point of being dry - as if it had been pre-made and sat in the fridge all afternoon. That night, at 2am, I was woken by F trying to swot an annoying insect - I put the light on to see a HUGE cockroach crawling out from under his pillow. It was so large they could have charged us for triple occupancy! We had planned on ordering room service breakfast the next morning, but before 9am some men began doing work on a neighbouring patio and it made so much noise we decided to venture back to the clubhouse - once again full of the loudest children I've ever come across. After a morning in Orlando we arrived back at the villa to find that once again our keys were not working - again, back to reception to have them re-issued. On our second and final morning we did order room service and were told it would arrive within 30 minutes. Actually it was closer to 60 and then the bill had to be sent back as it had the wrong room number on it. During our wait for breakfast, housekeeping knocked on the door to ask when we would be checking out. We said at about 11.30 - at 11am there came another knock, followed immediately by housekeeping letting themselves in! By now we were feeling rather hurried and not having the leisurely final morning we had planned. All in all, except for the roach, these were only minor issues, but they all added up to a rather annoying stay - not at all what we expected when we booked what (then) was the number one rated hotel in Orlando. My recommendation to you is don't bother - your money could be better spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “rooms smell like wet rag”
Reviews.Author: 2allanlisa
Reviews.Content: Told I was staying at the Hyatt was rudely told I was staying at the "Villas". Basicaly they were a third rate condo. Don't go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Overall, beware of lovebugs.”
Reviews.Author: Eve93
Reviews.Content: The Villas are superb, the layout is beautiful and having a private patio overlooking perfectly manicured lake and golf course, priceless... almost. In September, it seems, it is lovebug season. They are everywhere, in Biblical, plague-like quantities. They swarmed in front of our door (we had to rush in and out quickly so they would not invade the room, which they did anyway). The customer service is excellent, however. When we called to have the front door sprayed so that there wouldn't be quite so many, they were there in less than 10 minutes. All the lovebugs that were there at the time died (but no one swept them up). They came back, but in far less of a quantity. Other than the pest problem, we had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time and still great!”
Reviews.Author: DustonDude
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and I have stayed at The Villas. It was everything we remembered from the previous visit. This has to be the most relaxing place to stay in the Disney/Orlando area. We had a studio overlooking the first fairway. The room is great and now benefits from a large flat screen LCD TV. The staff are always friendly and the golf is great with 45 holes available to play. I brought my clubs along this time and managed to get in four rounds of golf as well as time on the driving range and free three practice holes. If youâ€™re looking for a place to bring your kids this probably isnâ€™t it as there is very little for them to do. Today is the last day of our stay and I am typing this using the free wireless connection which is available in all of the villas. Thanks yet again for a wonderful stay. We will be back again I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED Villas at Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: cafemom
Reviews.Content: It was my 60th Birthday and I wanted to stay young--wherelse to go but DisneyWorld! But, we didn't want to be surrounded by TOO much youth, so decided against staying at the Disney Resorts. After checking out various choices online, I decided on the Villas at Grand Cypress. We had stayed at the Grand Cypress for a meeting years ago, but wanted a little less hotel-feel, so opted for the quieter, more relaxed sister-resort at the Villas. As a sister resort, we could use any and all of the amenities at the Grand Cypress, but stay in a quieter setting. We loved it! The suite was great, the staff was charming and helpful, the casual lunches were good, and the setting and location perfect. Unfortunately due to remodeling, the fine dining restaurant was closed, but no problem finding another great place to celebrate the big birthday! It was a short stay, just 4 days, and we only did DisneyWorld one day. The other days were spent relaxing at the resort and enjoying the quiet pool, touring and visiting friends and feeling young! Thanks to the Villas for a really great vacation and birthday experience. Close to EVERYTHING (minutes from Disney, but away from the hustle), easy drive to the airport to Universal Studios, and Orlando and freeways. And, not too far from a Starbucks for those requisite coffee "fixes"!

Reviews.Title: “Door Man”
Reviews.Author: banyon
Reviews.Content: After spending ten days at a beautiful place called Marco Island about fifteen miles from Naples, we travelled up to Orlando to spend the remaining two nights of our holiday. We had enjoyed such a relaxing time before that and were a little reluctant to go to the manic city of Orlando but I had looked through the web site and found what looked to be a nice quiet resort and boy it was, we were met by a lovely door man who was tripping over himself to look after us, I was in a pair of old shorts and t shirt cause we had just travelled from the beach, we looked really scruffy arriving at this very up market resort, but that made no difference the staff were lovely and so was the room with a wonderful view overlooking their golf course. The next morning we went to the pool, there was hardly anyone there (which continued throughout our visit) we were offered cold glasses of water (no charge) or drinks from the bar (which we would of had to pay for). When driving around the resort all the staff waved and smiled at us. You would not believe that you were just a mile or so behind Downtown Disney it was like being out in the country. You also had the use of the Hyatt hotel which was a short drive away or you could cycle there on one of the resorts bikes (there was a lovely cycle path linking the two.) A wonderful place to stay would recommend to anybody. Look out for the racoon who likes looking down at you from the trees.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfort in a sea of madness ...”
Reviews.Author: theotherdave
Reviews.Content: Villas at Grand Cypress is tucked away from I-4 and area attractions just far enough that you easily forget you're actually right in the middle of everything. Peacefully quiet and very relaxing. We really enjoyed our stay, staff, accommodations and great service. So much so that my wife and I will be back this Sept. for our second visit of many to come. What was so odd was that we seemingly had the place to ourselves, yet the resort of 'full' according to staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place The Villas of Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: JK_GOLD_COAST
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay whether you are a golfer or on a family theme park holiday. We are a family of four and stayed in a 2 bedroom villa which was very spacious and luxurious. We had 2 bathrooms with spa baths, dining room, large living area with fireplace, fully eqipped kitchen and laundry. There is a plasma and entertainment system in the living area and a plasma in each bedroom. The service is excellent and we never had to wait more than 3 minutes for the shuttle to the Hyatt which would pick you up from your villa. Free Shuttles run from the Hyatt to most of the Disney resorts but if you plan on doing other attractions around Orlando such as Cape Canaveral I would recommend you hire a vehicle with a GPS(there are rental desks at the Hyatt) which is then also handy to get around the Disney resorts. The Villas are only a 5 minute drive from Downtown Disney and there is ample parking at all resorts. I would play golf early in the morning using the early bird rates(which includes free club hire) and then do the theme parks with the family. The golf courses were in great condition and the staff very friendly. There is also a nine hole chip & putt course (wedge & putter supplied) at the Hyatt which was great for the kids. All the facilities at the Hyatt are free to use for The Villas guests. In summary, if you want to play some golf during your stay at Disneyworld and want to stay somewhere thats spacious and comfortable at an affordable price, then this is the perfect place. JK, Gold Coast, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: ybool
Reviews.Content: After reading the review on trip advisor, we elected to stay here. The rate was a bit more than we wanted but this was a special occasion. It was worth the rate- the excellent staff, beautiful grounds, and amenities at this property made the experience relaxing and memorable. This property is very close to all the Orlando attractions, but once you enter the grounds you do feel like you are a hundred miles away from the bustle of the tourist strip. The fact that it shares many amenities with the Hyatt Grand Cypress across the street is a plus, as it gives you more to do on property. The hotel pool is a much better choice than the pool at the Villas if your kids are with you, as it is larger and has a Water Slide. If quiet pool side time is your goal, stay at the pool at the Villas, otherwise get the free shuttle across to the hotel. The lake and boats, the bikes to travel around the grounds, the pools, the nature trail, the jogging trails, the horse back riding- all make for an excellent unwinding spot within a short drive of the attractions of Orlando. The Villas appear much more relaxing than the hotel itself, as there is a great deal more privacy. The hotel was very nice at least in the lobby/ pool/ etc. We did not stay over there so I can't speak for the rooms. On-resort dining is probably the major draw back here- meals were pricey. However, you are within 10 mintues of a pile of restaurants, so you are by no means locked in to dining here. Also, the WiFi coverage in the Villas was a bit lacking. I had to go to the Club House to get good coverage.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and convenient for Parks !”
Reviews.Author: TheresaNY
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 BR villa that was simply unbelievable ! I cannot believe that I havebeen to this area so many times and thought that I would not be happy unless we stayed on Disney property for the "Disney Experience" and convenience of the transportation ! This wasfar better than I imagined. The villa is as beautiful as the most recent posts say it is. I would like to address the others like me who would be skeptical to stay off of WDW property: Give it a try, you will not be sorry. As long as you are not in commando park attack mode you will truly enjoy the Villas at Grand Cypress. It is right down the street from both DTD and Magic Kingdom. We parked at the TTC and went anywhere we wanted from there. We also incidentally ran across an entrance right into the parking lot from the back roads - and to go through the main gate to pay to park would have been out of our way (oops...I am sure they won'tgo bankrupt). The rest and relaxation from being out of the Disney Whirlwind for even a litle bit is nice - even with 2 kids ! The professionalism and courtesy at the Villas far surpasses ANYPLACE. The ability to throw a load of laundry on then run out and not have to be there to get it out right away is soooooooo nice ! The appliances are top line. Never even heard the machines run and I usually ran everything at night when we went to bed (except for the dishwasher - because the complimentary turn down service person always ran our dishwasher !!) The bathrobes were so comfy. We had a sleeper sofa and complimentary roll away since my daughters will no sleep together. Free internet, coffee, newspaper, everything you would expect from a luxury hotel. It was such a wonderful place ! If you are considering it but hesitant because of the whole "Disney' thing, don't let that deter you !! You will love it !

Reviews.Title: “Best of Everything in Central Florida”
Reviews.Author: numlock
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love this resort! The staff have been super - starting with the bellman, the front desk personnel, the attendants at the pool, everyone, even the personnel/guards at the entrance gate!! The villa accomodations have always been excellent, only minor things, light bulb or batteries in a remote needed, that's it!! We still feel this way despite a gliche in our first nights accomodation! Upon arrival we came to find out that our 1 bedroom suite was not available, and needed to spend our first night in a club suite (no kitchen, washer/dryer). We were disappointed at first, but were able to laugh later. Needless to say they (management) went out of their way to rectify the inconveneince and making the remainder of our stay great!!!!! We also love the availability of the Equestrian Center next door and the tremendous facilities down the road at the Hyatt Regency Hotel! We both agree along with many other guests that this resort is a true diamond in Disney's neighborhood!! No need to even consider staying at any of the Disney properties!!!! You are literally next door or 5 - 10 minutes from anywhere in Disney! Also, even though I rarely golf these days, this is a world -class golf resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “A "Grand" Stay at The Villas at Grand Cypress”
Reviews.Author: funtravel6
Reviews.Content: Often times, my family will stay at the usual chain hotels when visiting Orlando. This time, however, this time we elected to stay here. You could not ask for a better hotel! We stayed in their Junior Suite which was comfortable, quiet, and always private. The bathroom was spacious and the accommodations were beautiful! Moreover, the hotel staff was consistently professional. We were so happy with our choice and glad that we stayed here after their renovations. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for something more peaceful and inviting compared to the usual offerings in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “So close to a short cut to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: floridasgirl
Reviews.Content: After booking the villas and THEN realing the reviews was a bit worried but found it fine. We only had a club suite room so wasnt as big as the villas but we were only staying 2 night so served the purpose perfectly. Upon first arriving were greeted by really friendly security staff on the gate who took out name and by the time we got to reception we were greeted by name by the concierge which I though was a lovely touch. Found the check in staff to be perfectly friendly and were were then escorted to our villa by the concierge who settled us in and made us very welcome (thanks Gareth!). I do agree that these could do updating (mainly the suite in the bathroom which is a caramel sort of colour but everything was perfectly clean and it wouldnt stop me going back. Would stay again no problems but would probably book one of the bigger villas more suited to a family stay. Was brilliant for getting to Disney, a quick right turn out of the property and turn left and you are at Downtown withing 5 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: sooScotland
Reviews.Content: Just got back and had a truly wonderful stay at the villas. We were in a 1 bedroom, 2 adults and 1 child. The villas are very spacious and have been totally refurbished. New carpets, furniture, kitchen appliances everything it seems. The maid service was excellent, with a turn down service at night as well. They provide everything here, dishwasher tablets, washing powder, washing up liquid, tea, coffee,shampoo,soap etc... The grounds are immaculate and kept extremely clean and tidy, the gardeners are out every day tidying up. The pool area is lovely with sunbeds and tables and chairs. There is no childrens's section to the pool but they do have a hot tub, the deepest the pool goes to is 5 feet. They have a snack bar here as well where you can get cocktails, coffee, snacks etc. We visited the Hyatt which is about 3 miles away, you can get the courtesy bus or just take your own car. We were glad we had chosen the villas as it is a lot quieter, certainly the hotel was lovely, the pool area looked great with waterfalls and slides, more to do for older children here. We ate in the Hemmingway's restaurant one night, it was ok, better restaurants outside i felt. All in all a truly wonderful holiday here, if you are thinking of going, DO, I certainly didn't want to leave. Oh forgot to say, the ducks visited us every day for their daily feed of bread from our 3yr son, he loved it. I'm already planning to go back, I did a lot of research for our accommodation in Orlando and I'm so glad we found the Villas of Grand Cypress, we normally stay in 5 star properties, travel 3 times a year so I'm pretty hard to please, I would have no hesitation in recommending this property. The only negative was at the registration desk, the staff didn't seem very welcoming or friendly, shame as this is the first contact with customers. The concierge service was great, Margaret especially, she recommended restaurants and made reservations for us throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Tronsta
Reviews.Content: I could write for days about this place, but I'll keep it short and sweet. First, our expectations were: 1) Practical, reasonably priced resort with romantic tones. 2) A place not connected to Disney and/or not greatly effected by Disney crowds, traffic, kids, etc. 3) A place not too far from the International Airport in Orlando (MCO). We got all this and more. Before you read on, keep in mind that we came down in the middle of May, which seemed to be a bit of an off-season for Orlando. Hardly any Disney traffic on any of the major highways and smaller crowds. I hear in July it gets pretty jammed down there. Also, the weather was PERFECT during this time, upper 70's and lower 80's with no humidity. This also changes in July, so again, bear that in mind. And lastly, we stayed from a Monday to a Sunday, so the majority of our experience was during the week during an off-season. Once Friday came around, we saw a slight increase in the amount of people on the resort. Which isn't a big deal of course, but like I said, just keep it in mind. Ok let me get the bad stuff out of the way: 1) The grounds seemed to be under a lot of construction. This was, 99% of the time, around the golf course, so if you're not a golfer, as I and my wife are not, then you won't care much. 2) The rental bikes were pretty banged up so make sure if you rent them you get a good one. 3) There was a $25 a night fee they tacked on to the bill. This fee covers the pool, bike rental, and some other things they have there that are "free" to the Villas residents and is reasonable, but I just didn't like that no one said anything about the fee.
