It just gets added on to the bill. If you look close on some of the paperwork they give you, it mentions something about it. But this is after you've already booked the room. Not a huge deal, I just like to know what I'm expected to pay up front. 4) The pool water was strangely salty. I don't know if there is a new tasteless pool cleaner out there, but when pool water tastes like salt, it kind of gives me the willies. Not that I had a straw and was quenching my thirst with pool water, but if you are a swimmer, either casual or pro, you understand what I mean. 5) We stayed in a Club Suite, which was awesome, but it lacked a real fridge. You can kind of use the little honor bar fridge but there wasn't much room in it and it wasn't too cold. We got a foam cooler and kept ice in there. That's all the bad stuff. As you can see, none of that really should keep you from staying here and it certainly did not stop me from giving this place the highest rating. Ok on to the good stuff... 1) Aside from the construction, grounds overall are fantastic. It is a golf resort, so the majority of the landscaping is either golf course or golf course inspired, but if you've ever seen a golf course, you know that they are typically well groomed and beautiful. This place is no different. The area where the actual Villas lie sports brick roadways, a simple but beautiful pool with two hot tubs, and a pay bar with snacks open during the day. 2) Check in was painless and fast. We walked in, were offered free drinks (beer, even!) and our checkin couldn't have been faster. Then one of the wonderful staff members named Randy lead us to our Villa, a Club Suite. Randy was fantastic and friendly, took our bags, and bid us good day when we were all ready to settle in. 3) Once in our room, in a Club Suite, the only thing missing really was the fridge, as mentioned above. Other than that though, the place was fantastic and perfect for a honeymoon. For the price, you can't beat it. Big LCD TV, roman tub with plenty of room for two, seperate shower, HUGE bathroom, King Bed, patio overlooking a lake, nice closets, etc. The room was perfect for the money spent. Can't beat it. Housekeeping was great as well. Just make sure you leave a nice tip every night, it's a big room to clean. 4) Since the Villas and the Hyatt are together, you can explore the Hyatt grounds as if you are staying there. They have a HUGE pool (more kiddy attractions, so keep that in mind if you go there) and a game room, and their own bar and work-out room. We didn't use these much, but when we return to Grand Cypress (which we will for sure) we plan on using these more. The bikes were better at the Hyatt too so if you want to rent, rent them there. 5) Eat at the Black Swan at least ONCE. Very expensive but the food is outstanding. I recommend the souffle. Here's the summery: This place is VERY practical for the regular, average, everyday working folks like my wife and I. It's affordable, and they make you feel like a king and queen. It's a perfect location, just make sure you rent a car, as the shuttle service they provide is very limited. Fantasic honeymoon, didn't want to come back, reasonably priced, what more could you ask for? If you have any questions, feel free to email me anytime. tronsta@tmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gatoresq
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in Orlando with my 8yo daughter. Stayed here with a pal and his 2 girls in a 2br/2ba - Perfect layout for 2 families - 2 master bedrooms on opposite ends of the unit (ours had very comfortable kings in each bedroom plus a fold out queen couch)- tons of space and privacy - great bathrooms and great housekeeping kept us stocked with plenty of pillows and towels for all! very clean - very upscale - very comfortable - very quiet - great water and golf views from every room - several very large outside patios for relaxing - getting sun - eating room service (which was delivered incredibly fast!) - feeding the ducks - watching the golfers and even DW fireworks at night (much rather see them from here than packed like a sardine on DW Main Street). Full sized and well-stocked kitchen/refrig/ microwave/ coffee maker/washer dryer. our unit even had very large and separate living and dining rooms. Grounds were beautiful - Easy check-in (although a little snotty at the golf club) - complete with complimentary cocktails - which is always a big plus (even more so when in Orlando). Great pool and hot tubs, not to mention two jacuzzis right in our room (one in each bathroom) which kept the kids busy for hours while us dads vegged out and watched a (one of 3) large screen plasma which was hung over a wood-burning fireplace which was conveniently located right next to the wet bar. minutes from all disney parks and tons of restaurants but it might as well have been a world away - never fear - peace and quiet and a beautiful relaxing oasis does exist for those traveling to Orlando, and this place is it! I'm just sorry I didn't know about it sooner, since I've previously paid much more elsewhere, and didn't get 1/2 as much - or 1/3 as nice as this place. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: TroseM
Reviews.Content: It was a magical stay...My husband and I travel with our 6 year old twin girls to visit Disney World we stayed in a one bedroom villa...Just to start I was not looking foward to having to go DW and standing in long lines and in the heat...but I know it was something we had to do...so I wanted to make sure the place we stay was something special to go back to...After doing alot of research and comparing properties with the dw ones Yacht Club, Polyenissian,Grand Floridan and the Beach Club none of them could offer what the Grand Cypress could your own private villa with full kitchens,patios, Spacious sleeping areas and living areas. the maid service was great they come twice a day once in the morning to clean and again at night to turn your beds down and close your blinds. check in was a breeze pull right up they open your door you walk in and the clerk already has all of your information and to top off they offer you something to drink. Everything was beautifully landscaped we could see dw fireworks from our villa which was a plus and it had wonderful sunsets and ducks to feed. We went to the Pool at the Grand Hyatt which was alot of fun and again the service was a great. After exploring the Grand Hyatt I was so happy we stay at the villas instead. It made our Disney World experience magical.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply, fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: kittyhola
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa for 7 nights with our children aged 10 and 8. We agreed that this is one of the best places we have ever stayed in. The villa is so spacious with 2 enormous en suite bedrooms both with huge flat screen TV's. The beds were sumptuous, my girls practically disappeared in theirs amongst all the pillows and cushions! The bathrooms were fabulous, more towels than I've ever seen, tons of little complimentary soaps, shampoos etc. The kitchen was absolutely fine, don't know how anyone can complain about it. We only used it to make tea - how English I know - but it was v well equipped with dishwasher, washer/dryer etc. You could live there! We hired bikes on the first day. It's perfect for biking as there is basically no traffic to contend with apart from golf buggies. We biked to and from breakfast at the Clubhouse everyday - essential given the size of the portions! We were on the breakfast plan and I'm really glad we chose it because it was so convenient and so nice. The swimming pool is lovely, a very chilled area to relax in. Unfortunately we were beaten by some unseasonably cold weather and only got to use the pool a couple of times. We also visited the Hyatt and the pool there looked fabulous but we never got around to using it. The staff are wonderful - very efficient and obliging. The one evening we ate in the Clubhouse the service was very slow and when the meal arrived it was cold. The staff were extremely apologetic, took care of the bill, made us a special dessert and plied us with after dinner drinks. The Villas are very close to all the Disney Parks. We found it very quick and easy to drive to all of them. This place is the perfect antidote to the madness of Disney. After sharing Magic Kingdom with 88,000 other people over the Easter period our luxurious villa was quite simply heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay / Parfait sÃ©jour golfique”
Reviews.Author: Resquator
Reviews.Content: I've been there for 2 days in March 2007. Great place to stay. I enjoyed 3 rounds of golf and have rest in my private villa-room and got much golf pleasure. People was helpfully, kind and very professionnal. (no tip to provide) Courses (I've played all the 45 holes) were perfect and starter and golf personnal were top. The villa is very clean and big. Nice view on course. I really recommand this place to get golf trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal In Orlando”
Reviews.Author: drmaxwell
Reviews.Content: The Villas are a great deal for the Orlando area, especially if you need alot of space. The property is lovely and quiet since this is first and foremost a golf resort. The units are very spacious and nicely furnished. The carpet and bedspreads had seen better days, however, and our tiny kitchen was in desperate need of renovation. Our refrigerator needed to be fixed twice during our stay and the enormous microwave looked like it was manufactured in the 70's. I was told that many villas have been recently remodeled so be sure to ask for a newer unit. That may explain the differences in opinions as to whether the Villas are a bit "grungy" or fantastic. Families need to be aware that the Villas cater primarily to golfers. If you want two double beds in your rooms, make sure you book straight with the hotel and get a guarantee in writing. We didn't and ended up using an air mattress in one room. I wasn't thrilled with the reception staff (allergic to children) but everyone else was great. The shuttle came promptly when we wanted to use the "fun" pool over at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, Except for the Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Cube34
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion at the Villas of grand Cypress and really had a fantastic time. With ages from 77 to less than a year we needed a place that catered to all tastes and needs. The grounds are absolutely georgous and meticulously maintaned, unfortunately we couldn't say the same for the rooms (we had 4 total villas). The toilets ran constantly, the sink stoppers didn't work, the toaster arced and sparked and the general cleanliness was far less than you'd expect for a resort of this caliber. That being said the rooms are large with plenty of room both inside and outside. Our location on the water with views of the golf course was very relaxing and conducive to our nightly cocktail party. The fireplace was great and used each night due to the cool temps with wood supplied generously by the resort. The pool is secluded and quiet with most of the action a shuttle ride away at the main Hyatt resort. The kids gravitated toward the Hyatt side of the resort and loved the game room and the free 9 hole Pitch n' Putt. Shuttles were fast and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: BQD
Reviews.Content: For anyone that wants a luxurious oasis of calm at the heart of the Orlando tourist belt, this is the perfect place. Not quite as swanky as the Ritz Carlton, it's still a very upmarket resort with twice daily maid service, full room service, etc. On top of this, each villa has the advantage of a kitchen (great for making something simple when you've had enough of eating out) with washer/dryer. The two bedroom villa we stayed in was a massive 1700 sq ft, with three terraces, and bordered a large pond full of wildlife. Each evening we'd sit by the water throwing bread to the fish, ducks, turtles and ibis that swam up to greet us. The villas are grouped in courtyards which in turn are grouped around a scenically located pool. Waiter service at the pool was sporadic in December but we often had the place to ourselves and the water must have been pushing 90 as I could walk straight in without the slightest grimace. Located on a massive property with its own golf courses, guests can cycle round on free-to-borrow bikes or go jogging. Top quality horseriding is also available just up the road with a free shuttle to take you to the stables. My seven year old son had two lessons with a first class instructor who was good with kids. Guests at the Villas are entitled to use all the facilities at the nearby Hyatt Regency which has some of the best restaurants in the Orlando area. You can call up a free shuttle to take you there. When our week was up, we could hardly bare to leave this fantastic retreat. I can't praise it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: onemonga
Reviews.Content: We took our family vacation to Florida this year because none of us had been there and we had to find a place that would be toddler friendly. Well, we hit the motherload of resorts with The Villas of Grand Cypress. The grounds were beautiful and the service was above and beyond great. The two bedroom villa was showing a little bit of age but it was obvious that a great amount of remodeling was going on. We went to the Magic Kingdom on the second day of our visit and when we returned to our room that evening we found three new flat panel t.v.s, one a 42inch plasma in the living room and each bedroom had a new 32inch LCD. The $15.00 resort fee per bedroom is a steal because it covers bike rentals(you can keep them at your villa), pools, all the amenities at The Grand Hyatt, which include pitch and putt, tennis, huge swimming pools, bikes for four and boat rentals. Our 17month old Granddaughter will not remember how much fun we had but when she is older we will take her back to the Villas and we can add to our memory book of great vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: AHFox
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Labor Day weekend 2006. After spending a week at Marriott's Cypress Harbour with sister in-law's family and doing "the Disney Thing" for 6 straight days, my husband and I (with six year old son) were ready to "wind down" and relax a bit. So when they (sister in law, her husband and two boys) headed back home, we checked into Grand Cypress. We were in a one bedroom villa, directly on the golf course, and next to the villa pool. My husband played golf for three days - I believe they have 5 or 6 courses on site. Guests of the Villas have access to the all the facilities of the Hyatt Grand Cypress right down the road. This is where you will find the absolutley immense pool with underwater caves, a suspension bridge and several water slides. They have a "kids camp" program that runs all day. This is where our six year old spent his time. I absolutely loved the villa pool, and preferred to be there, right next to our villa. The pool is very large, beautifully landscaped, and peacefully quiet. There is a bar right next to the pool, and you can order food from the clubhouse restaurant right there. It will be delivered to you poolside, with linens and silverware. The quality of the food is outstanding, The service is impeccable. I really can't find enough good things to say about this resort. There are many other recreational activities in addition to the outstanding golf courses. They have bicycles for rent next to the pool area. They also have an outstanding equestrian center with a large tack shop and covered riding arena. If you're not an accomplished horseman, there is also a western trail ride available over at the Hyatt Grand Cypress. The villa itself was spacious, with a beautiful patio area overlooking one of the golf courses. A wonderful living room, wet bar, full dining room, kitchen, bedroom, and large bath with a spa tub. Room service was prompt, service was excellent. The housekeeping staff were all wonderful. We're planning a return trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Adam1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the villas with my girlfriend for her 21st birthday, and did all the usual features. Couldn't fault the staff, facilities or accomodation throughout, with only one exception, they wouldn't provide us with a key to the mini-bar until she was 21, but that's a tiny little thing. Found the staff to be exceptionally friendly, from the moment we pulled up to the security station at the main entrance. Only fault i could find was with some of the other guests who decided parental care consisted of leaving their children (would guess aged 8/9) by the pool all day unsupervised to run around disrupting those of us who were trying to relax! Neither of us can wait to go back, since they went above and beyond for us, even giving my girlfriend a big basket of treats on her actual birthday.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, outdated, grungy”
Reviews.Author: Traveler004
Reviews.Content: I also encountered polite and helpful, albiet confused staff. I had made my reservation on their own website but they coulldn't find it. Then when they did find it had they had the wrong rate, showing $500 per night (yikes!) instead of $199 per night. Luckily I had my confirmation email they had sent. The property feels pretty isolated (but really isn't) and you wind through a large golf course to get to the villa compunds. Although I don't golf, I liked the setting. My villa rooms were HUGE, with tons of windows and French doors everywhere which was great, plus not one but two patios. But I realized slowly that I felt as though I was on the set of Golden Girls. I felt like I was in someone's retirement community home. Not my own grandparents', but someone's younger grandparents who would have decorated in the 80s (hence the Golden Girls feeling). I also slowly realized that my villa wasn't very clean which really bothers me. The rattan tray used to display toiletries was covered with a film of grunge, hair, dust, etc. - ick. It looked like it had never been cleaned. There were other areas needing serious re-cleaning. Also the shower had drainage problems. The kitchen was great to have but as noted by others, out of date. Appliances were old, banged and scratched up and at least in my villa, a bit grungy. All of the trimwork and cabinetry in all rooms looked to have been installed in the 50s or 60s. If my villa had been clean I would have rated it 3 dots or neutral/average. If it had been clean and had modern amenities I would have rated it 4 dots or above average.

HotelInfo.Name: The Villas of Grand Cypress
HotelInfo.Address: One North Jacaranda, Orlando, FL 32836-6699
